snippet.title: [ADW24-D3-S09] DITA 2.0 – Let's get it started! (Leroy Steinbacher)
snippet.description:
[ADW24-D3-S09] DITA 2.0 – Let's get it started!

Adobe DITAWORLD 2024
DITA 2.0 – Let's get it started! How to Embrace and Implement the Exciting New Features of the coming DITA 2.0

Speaker:
- Leroy Steinbacher, Senior Solution Consultant at Adobe

About this Session:
With the much-anticipated release of DITA 2.0, the landscape of technical content is about to transform. This session, led by Leroy Steinbacher, a Senior Solutions Consultant at Adobe and a recent member of the DITA Technical Committee, is your gateway to understanding and harnessing the power of this revolutionary update. “DITA 2.0 – Let’s get it started!” is not just an introduction but a comprehensive dive into the future of content creation and management with the future of DITA.

In this session, Leroy will shed light on the current status of DITA 2.0, answering burning questions about its official release and practical implementation. He will also guide you through the nuances of adding DITA 2.0 to your technical stack, even if your current setup doesn’t support it yet. Discover the ease of integrating DITA 2.0 as a specialization, enabling the creation of advanced topics and maps that leverage its new features.

Engage with sample content that demonstrates DITA 2.0’s innovative capabilities. This hands-on approach will showcase the enhancements and provide you with the skills to edit and publish using the latest technical content standards.

Key Takeaways:
- Release Update: Get the latest information on the timing and updates of the DITA 2.0 release.
- Technical Specs Review: Deep dive into the technical specifications and supporting documents of DITA 2.0.
- DTD Reference: Learn how to reference the DITA 2.0 Document Type Definition (DTD).
- Content Creation: Gain practical skills in creating DITA 2.0 content.


Event Website:
https://2024-adobe-dita-world.meetus.adobeevents.com

snippet.title: [ADW24-D3-S08] Building PDF Stylesheets with AEM Guides (Aswini Lakshminarayanan, Surbhi Maheshwari)
snippet.description:
Adobe DITAWORLD 2024
Build your PDF Stylesheets like a Pro with Adobe Experience Manager Guides
Advanced PDF Styling: Master the Art with Adobe’s Cloud-Native Engine

Speakers:
- Aswini Lakshminarayanan, Product Solutions Consultant at Adobe
- Surbhi Maheshwari, Computer Scientist, Adobe

About this Session:
Creating visually compelling and functionally robust PDFs for technical content can be challenging. In his session, Aswini Lakshminarayanan, Product Solutions Consultant at Adobe, will dive into cloud-based PDF publishing with Adobe Experience Manager Guides, where accessibility meets speed and functionality in creating exceptional PDF documents.
This session will guide you through the nuances of using W3C CSS3 for content styling and CSS Paged Media standards for defining properties such as size, margins, orientation, and more. Learn how these standards are employed in Adobe’s Native PDF publishing to ensure consistent, high-quality PDF outputs that resonate with your audience.
The session will cover a spectrum of topics, including using metadata in PDF output, advanced troubleshooting techniques, and the latest developments in Native PDF publishing. Whether discussing use cases and specific requirements or exploring the intricacies of PDF styling and layout, this session will significantly enhance your publishing capabilities.

Key Takeaways:
- Metadata Integration: Discover how to use System or DITA metadata in your PDF output.
- Cross-Referencing: Master the techniques for cross-referencing tables, figures, headings, and paragraphs in your PDFs.
- Variable Configuration: Learn to use variables to configure DITA objects for localized output, enhancing the versatility of your content.
- Styling and Formatting: Elevate your PDFs with page formatting, styling, conditional watermarks, and more. A range of options is awaiting you!
- Troubleshooting Skills: Gain insights into troubleshooting using intermediate HTML and other advanced techniques.
- Latest Developments: Stay updated with recent advancements like language variables and the redesigned CSS editor.


Event Website:
https://2024-adobe-dita-world.meetus.adobeevents.com

snippet.title: [ADW24-D3-S07] Leveraging DITA Content for Marketing (Kunwar Vikrant Singh)
snippet.description:
Adobe DITAWORLD 2024
Leveraging DITA Content for Marketing – Publishing Structured Content to Adobe Experience Manager Sites

Speaker:
- Kunwar Vikrant Singh, Solutions Consultant at Adobe

About this Session:
Join Kunwar Vikrant Singh, Solutions Consultant for Technical Communication at Adobe, as he discusses the practicalities of deploying DITA content across multiple channels using Adobe Experience Manager Guides. Imagine crafting technical documentation in AEM Guides as Structured Content with DITA and then seamlessly integrating parts of it into your product websites for the marketing content.
This session will cover the efficient use of AEM Guides to author DITA Topics and publish them as Content Fragments or Experience Fragmetns for use in AEM Sites. This method streamlines the integration of technical content into product websites, facilitating consistent branding and messaging across different platforms.

Key Takeaways:
- Content Conversion: Learn how to transform DITA topics into Content Fragments for seamless integration into Adobe Expe
- Instant Updates: See how real-time updates in DITA content ensure accuracy and consistency across all deployed content.
- Scalable Architecture: Explore how to design a content structure that supports large-scale and complex content management efficiently.


Event Website:
https://2024-adobe-dita-world.meetus.adobeevents.com

snippet.title: [ADW24-D3-S06] Boogie Shoes – Choose Your Boogie Shoes Brand With One Topic! (Bo Jensen)
snippet.description:
Adobe DITAWORLD 2024
Boogie Shoes – Choose Your Boogie Shoes Brand With One Topic!

Speaker:
- Bo Jensen, CEO of BJ DITA consulting, Denmark

About this Session:
We will build up boogie shoes with different product brand within one topic, work with DITA keys in Adobe Experience Manager Guides and show how we can reuse topics for multiple brands. This will involve collection files, conref and conkeyref in DITA and AEM Guides, and other exciting things!

Key Takeaways:
- Content Reuse: How to make huge reuse in Adobe Experience Manager Guides.
- Manage Content and Objects: How to handle not just content but objects with conkeyref in DITA and Adobe Experience Manager Guides.
- Manage Brands: How to work smart with folder structures and different product brands.

snippet.title: [ADW24-D3-S05] Ready, Set, Go! How to Prepare and Train a Team for DITA (Amanda Patterson)
snippet.description:
[ADW24-D3-S05] Ready, Set, Go! How to Prepare and Train a Team for DITA

Adobe DITAWORLD 2024
Ready, Set, Go! How to Prepare and Train a Team for DITA.

Speaker:
- Amanda Patterson, PHD

About this Session
Have you ever felt overwhelmed about introducing DITA with your team? You're not alone. Amanda Patterson, former Technical Communication Manager at Hunter Douglas, knows the problem. In this session, she lifts the curtain on the journey her team (and herself!) has been on at Hunter Douglas. It's a story about what they had planned, what actually happened, and how she and her team mastered learning DITA together.
Amanda explains the intricacies of preparing your team by not overwhelming them with information but really involving them in the process. How do you get a diverse group of people on the same page, especially with something as complicated as DITA? It's about more than just timelines and training modules; it's about understanding the team's dynamics, fears, and strengths.
Amanda will share her successes and surprising moments, from the early days of basic DITA concepts to the topics of structured authoring. Look forward to an honest talk about the tools that made the difference for her (yes, even YouTube and webinars did it) and how they made training a real pleasure.
This presentation is aimed at technical communication managers, team leaders, and others guiding the adoption of DITA. It provides a pragmatic and insightful guide to managing change, avoiding pitfalls, and realizing the full potential of DITA in your team.

Key Takeaways:
- Strategic Team Preparation: Techniques for effectively preparing your team for DITA adoption, ensuring a unified skill set.
- Navigating Cultural Shifts: Strategies for managing the significant cultural transition to structured authoring, maintaining team coherence.
- Tailored Training Programs: How to design and implement training sessions that cater to diverse learning styles and knowledge levels.
- Leveraging Tools for Success: Identifying and utilizing the best tools and resources to facilitate learning and implementation.
- Real-World Implementation Lessons: Practical insights and lessons learned from the trenches of DITA implementation, emphasizing the importance of flexibility and continuous learning.


Event Website:
https://2024-adobe-dita-world.meetus.adobeevents.com

snippet.title: [ADW24-D3-S03] IDC – How a CCMS Powers Digital Transformation (Holly Muscolino, IDC)
snippet.description:
Adobe DITAWORLD 2024
From Siloed Content to Streamlined Workflows – How a CCMS Powers Digital Transformation

Speaker:
- Holly Muscolino, Group VP Workplace Solutions, IDC

About this Session
IDC defines a “digital business” as one where value creation is based and dependent on the use of digital technologies – from how processes are run to the products, services, and experiences it provides. But a March 2024 global survey indicates that over 80 % of organizations are still on that journey: they have a digital strategy and are in the process of transforming their business. Content is the lifeblood of business, and any digital strategy must include transformation of content-centric business processes. A critical technology in the digital transformation (DX) toolkit is a component content management system (CCMS).
If you are a decision-maker embarking on your DX journey, this session will provide the inspiration you need to effectively build your content technology portfolio.

Key Takeaways:
- Review the current state of content-centric business processes within organizations today, including key challenges
- Examine how a CCMS addresses these challenges and provides important business benefits
- Explore a unified content model for enterprise content management
- Considers the impact of AI including example use cases


Event Website:
https://2024-adobe-dita-world.meetus.adobeevents.com

snippet.title: [ADW24-D2-S09] Mastering the AEM Guides Extension Framework (Aswini Lakshminarayanan, Divraj Singh)
snippet.description:
Adobe DITAWORLD 2024
Mastering the Adobe Experience Manager Guides Extension Framework
Next-Level Customization in Adobe Experience Manager Guides

Speakers:
- Divraj Singh, Senior Manager Solutions Consulting at Adobe
- Aswini Lakshminarayanan, Solutions Consultant at Adobe

About this Session:
Welcome to the world where code meets content management. In this developer-centric session, join Adobe experts Divraj Singh and Aswini Lakshminarayanan as they explore the technical depths of the Adobe Experience Manager Guides Extension Framework. Developers who want to push the boundaries of AEM Guides and expand its capabilities beyond the default offerings will benefit from this session.
This session will explore the architecture of the AEM Guides Extension Framework and demonstrate how to harness its power to build custom extensions. It covers everything, from tweaking the UI to suit your team’s workflow to creating custom panels to assist authoring to integrating additional tools into the web editor.
Divraj and Aswini will provide hands-on examples, coding best practices, and practical tips for effectively leveraging the Extension Framework. You’ll get an insider’s look at navigating the framework, creating custom modules, and integrating advanced customizations into your AEM Guides setup.
If you are looking for cool, innovative ways to extend Adobe Experience Manager Guides with custom solutions, this session is for you. Get ready to elevate your skills and bring a new level of customization to Adobe Exper

Key Takeaways:
- Deep Dive into the Framework: A thorough exploration of the AEM Guides Extension Framework’s architecture and components.
- Custom Extension Building: Strategies and techniques for developing custom extensions tailored to your needs.
- Advanced Integration: Insights into integrating AEM Guides with external systems.
Hands-On Examples: Real-life coding examples demonstrating the practical application of the Extension Framework.
- Best Coding Practices: Tips and best practices for coding within the AEM environment to maximize efficiency and effectiveness.

https://2024-adobe-dita-world.meetus.adobeevents.com

snippet.title: [ADW24-D2-S08] Translation Management with Adobe Experience Manager Guides (Kunwar Vikrant Singh)
snippet.description:
Adobe DITAWORLD 2024
Lost in Translation Management?
How Adobe Experience Manager Guides Streamlines Multilingual Content Management

Speaker:
- Kunwar Vikrant Singh, Solutions Consultant at Adobe


About this Session
In today’s globalized digital landscape, where content crosses borders as effortlessly as it does time zones, the necessity for multilingual communication has never been more pronounced. Kunwar Vikrant Singh, Solutions Consultant for Technical Communication at Adobe, presents a session that’s not just about translating content but about transcending language barriers for global organizations.

In this session, Kunwar Vikrant Singh, Solutions Consultant for Technical Communication at Adobe, walks through the powerful Translation Management in Adobe Experience Manager Guides, Adobe’s cutting-edge CCMS – AEM Guides. It streamlines translation workflows and integrates seamlessly with various translation service providers. Kunwar will explore how AEM Guides brings together the world of machine translation and human translation.

Discover the innovative approach AEM Guides offers for navigating translation management complexities. The session unpacks how the hybrid approach enhances efficiency through machine-based translation integrations and cultivates precision and nuance through human translation.

Key Takeaways:
- Efficiency and Scalability: Unlock the potential of machine-based translation in AEM Guides for faster and broader content reach.
- Collaborative Translation Management: Learn how AEM Guides orchestrates collaboration among content authors, translators, and reviewers, fostering an environment where you can manage feedback and corrections effortlessly.
- Hybrid Translation Approach: Embrace the best of both worlds by combining machine translation’s speed with the quality assurance of human review, ensuring content accuracy and cultural relevance.
- Real-Time Translation Monitoring: Gain insights into how AEM Guides offers real-time tracking of translation progress, enabling better project management and timeline efficiency.


Event Website:
https://2024-adobe-dita-world.meetus.adobeevents.com

snippet.title: [ADW24-D2-S07] Leveraging External Data Sources in AEM Guides (Leroy Steinbacher)
snippet.description:
Adobe DITAWORLD 2024
Connecting Worlds: From Data to Delivery
Leveraging External Data Sources in Adobe Experience Manager Guides

Speaker:
- Leroy Steinbacher, Senior Solutions Consultant at Adobe

About this Session
In modern content creation, efficiently integrating and updating external data within your technical documentation is necessary. In this session, Leroy Steinbacher, Senior Solutions Consultant at Adobe, presents an innovative solution to this challenge.

Dive into Adobe Experience Manager Guides, which now serves as a pivotal bridge, eliminating the time-consuming task of manual content updates from external sources. This session explores the groundbreaking out-of-the-box connectors that Adobe Experience Manager Guides offers, allowing seamless integration with an array of external data sources like JIRA, Product Information Management systems (PIMs), MySQL databases, and Product Lifecycle Management systems (PLMs).

Learn how this integration transforms the way technical communicators handle specifications, product details, and other dynamic data, ensuring that your content is always up-to-date and accurate, mitigating the risk of outdated information.

Key Takeaways
- Data Source Integration: Learn about the variety of data sources you can seamlessly integrate with Adobe Exper
- MySQL Connection Setup: Discover the steps to connect with a MySQL database for real-time data synchronization.
- Web Editor View: Explore how to view and manage data pulled from connectors within the AEM Guides web editor interface.
- Content Mapping: Learn the art of mapping externally sourced data references within a DITA topic for optimal content relevancy.
- Topic Generation: Learn to create and update topics using the innovative topic generator feature in Adobe Exper

Event Website:
https://2024-adobe-dita-world.meetus.adobeevents.com

snippet.title: Beginner Blender 4.0 Tutorial - Part 14: Finale!
snippet.description:
Let's finish this bad boy 🍩 Join the waitlist for my upcoming Blender course: https://blender-guru.mykajabi.com/opt-in

In this final part of the series, you'll learn how to turn your image sequence into a video using Blender's video sequencer. Plus a donut challenge!

===Links🔗===

Blender Guru Discord: https://blenderguru.com/discord

Keyboard Shortcut Cheat Sheet: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1zPBgZAdftWa6WVa7UIFUqW_7EcqOYE0X743RqFuJL3o/edit?usp=sharing

Industry Compatible Cheat Sheet (not mine, used with permission): https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fi/dboz7fuh0f5255n5ocrdl/BlenderKeymap-IndustryCompatible_v2.pdf?rlkey=2yxe23jev9y2qmdg7txrzy8ip&dl=0

Blender Guru: http://www.blenderguru.com 
Poliigon (My sister company): http://www.poliigon.com High-quality Models, Textures, HDRIs

=== Chapter Marks ✂️===
0:00 Intro
0:24 Blender for Beginners Course 
1:26 Editing in Premiere
2:04 Video Editing in Blender
2:42 Loading an image sequence
3:58 Holding the last frame
4:42 Fading to black
6:04 Exporting the final video
9:32 Donut variation challenge!

snippet.title: Beginner Blender 4.0 Tutorial - Part 13: Rendering
snippet.description:
Time to finally render that 🍩 Watch Part 14: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xkt4HEEgoSE&list=PLjEaoINr3zgEPv5y--4MKpciLaoQYZB1Z&index=15

In this video you'll discover how to determine the correct sample count, rendering to a still image sequence, and undergoing a Pre-Rendering Checklist.

===Links🔗===

Blender Guru Discord: https://blenderguru.com/discord

Keyboard Shortcut Cheat Sheet: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1zPBgZAdftWa6WVa7UIFUqW_7EcqOYE0X743RqFuJL3o/edit?usp=sharing

Industry Compatible Cheat Sheet (not mine, used with permission): https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fi/dboz7fuh0f5255n5ocrdl/BlenderKeymap-IndustryCompatible_v2.pdf?rlkey=2yxe23jev9y2qmdg7txrzy8ip&dl=0

Blender Guru: http://www.blenderguru.com 
Poliigon (My sister company): http://www.poliigon.com High-quality Models, Textures, HDRIs

=== Chapter Marks ✂️===
0:00 Choosing the sample count
2:52 Noise threshold
3:40 Time limit
4:02 Rendering to a still image sequence
7:14 Pre-Rendering Checklist Time!
7:40 Face orientation check
9:08 Unwanted object check
9:58 Intersection check
10:14 Improving the composition
12:53 Improving the lighting
14:46 Exposure check
16:18 Color check
17:09 Adding SSS to the donut
17:43 Improving the sprinkles
20:17 Adding Big Medium Small details
22:42 Improving the Sky lighting
23:14 Adding Depth of Field
24:42 Adding Motion Blur
25:06 Fixing final problems

snippet.title: Beginner Blender 4.0 Tutorial - Part 12: Animation
snippet.description:
Let's animate that donut 🍩 Watch Part 13: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fSfFkh2sI4k&list=PLjEaoINr3zgEPv5y--4MKpciLaoQYZB1Z&index=14

In this video you'll learn the basics of animation in Blender: placing keyframes, easing the interpolation, the dope sheet, the graph editor, frame rates and more.

===Links🔗===

Blender Guru Discord: https://blenderguru.com/discord

Keyboard Shortcut Cheat Sheet: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1zPBgZAdftWa6WVa7UIFUqW_7EcqOYE0X743RqFuJL3o/edit?usp=sharing

Industry Compatible Cheat Sheet (not mine, used with permission): https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fi/dboz7fuh0f5255n5ocrdl/BlenderKeymap-IndustryCompatible_v2.pdf?rlkey=2yxe23jev9y2qmdg7txrzy8ip&dl=0

Poliigon (My sister company): http://www.poliigon.com High-quality Models, Textures, HDRIs

snippet.title: Rampart | Dark Fantasy Ambient Music | Relaxing Ambient Soundscapes (Dark Souls Inspired)
snippet.description:
Inspired by the Souls games — Demon's Souls, Dark Souls, and Elden Ring, which I am currently playing. I wanted to create relaxing yet dark ambient music that fits the atmosphere perfectly for farming or simply wandering in the world.

Welcome to Chronoscapes, your portal to captivating ambient music for every mood and moment.

Cinematic soundscapes that transport you to new worlds
Dark and mysterious ambiences for introspection
Relaxing and meditative melodies for peace and tranquility
Heavenly and ethereal textures for a sense of wonder
Sci-fi and futuristic soundscapes for imaginative journeys

I'm creating immersive experiences perfect for:

😴 Sleep and relaxation
🧘 Meditation and mindfulness
📚 Reading and focus
🤓 Studying and concentration
🏢 Work and productivity

Whether you seek ethereal ambience, sci-fi soundscapes, or something in between, Chronoscapes got you covered.

#darkambientmusic 
#eldenring  
#ambientmusic 
#fantasyambient   

I greatly appreciate you listening to my music, as well as your generous likes 👍, thoughtful comments ✏️, and subscribing with the notification bell 🔔 ON

©2024 All music on this channel is exclusively created by Chronoscapes and protected by copyright law. Unauthorized use of any tracks is prohibited without my written permission.

snippet.title: Paradise Lost | Dark Ethereal Ambient Music | Blade Runner Sci Fi Music | Relax, Focus, Study
snippet.description:
In a not-so-distant future, Earth was on the brink of an energy crisis. Fossil fuels had run dry, and humanity’s desperate grasp at sustainable alternatives had led to sprawling fields of solar panels across every continent but a colossal alien mothership hovers over a vital solar field. Its immense shadow blocks sunlight, causing a loss of electricity. Without power, people begin to starve, turning the once hopeful symbol of cooperation into a harbinger of despair.

Welcome to Chronoscapes, your portal to captivating ambient music for every mood and moment.

Cinematic soundscapes that transport you to new worlds
Dark and mysterious ambiences for introspection
Relaxing and meditative melodies for peace and tranquility

snippet.title: You Touch, You Buy.
snippet.description:
For the first time since 2017, I recorded the process behind one of my artworks. Much of what you can see in this short film was broadcasted live on Twitch. It shows my interpretation of Bobs workplace plus additional pieces that highlight the sticky and moldy nature of his business. Everything’s been touched before, nothing is new. Mint condition, but not really.

Thanks, love, praise & eternal glory goes out to:
Jasmin Dämmrich, Alex Rych, Raphael Rau, Lukas Guziel, Ash Thorp, Billy Chitkin, Jeremy Cox, Dino Muhic and literally hundreds of people who were constantly cheering and supporting me with their knowledge, kindness and love during long days of streaming. I would love to make a list with all your names, but I can’t, because you were so many. I will never forget you though.

The project would not have been possible without the help of RNDR.
https://rendertoken.com/

Music by the glorious Lukas Guziel.
https://soundcloud.com/lukas-guziel
https://open.spotify.com/artist/6Saw1XvD0o49wr2R9B8zdi?si=sj-zClKPSBaM1tXaEnHIiA

--

► TWITCH: https://twitch.tv/planetzomax
► TWITTER: https://twitter.com/planetzomax
► INSTAGRAM: https://instagram.com/corneliusdammrich/
► BEHANCE: https://behance.net/eimer

--

128GB DDR4

snippet.title: Blender Grease Pencil for illustrators and animators - Conference + live drawing
snippet.description:
This conference was not only intended for artists but also for a general audience, to help them understand this new animation technique and maybe motivate them to start a new hobby XD. 
Thanks to Mauro Rego for presenting the conference, and also Daniela and the team for the organization ! This was a private conference, but here it is finally available for everyone.

In such a short time, it is impossible to go deep and show all the possibilities of Blender and the grease pencil tool, but I hope this presentation and live drawing will be enough to make you want to go further on learning 2d/3d animation.

00:00 Introduction, what can you do with Blender
03:24 Let's open and explore a blender file !
09:50 Making a simple animation : the drawing tools, modifiers and duplicates
26:58 Intermediate animation
46:09 The end result, and extra modifications

Thanks for your support on my tipeee page !

https://tipeee.com/dedouze

snippet.title: Retro Emulation on iPhone/iOS Tested: The Floodgates Have Opened!
snippet.description:
While Android devices have played host to retro game emulation for many years now, the same can't be said for iOS... until recently, that is. Apple has lifted the emulation ban, opening the door to a range of perfectly playable experiences based on emulated 8-bit and 16-bit systems. But what about more demanding systems like PlayStation, PSP and Nintendo 64? Oliver Mackenzie has this exhaustive breakdown.

snippet.title: Upscaling Face-Off: FSR 3.1 vs DLSS 3.7/ XeSS 1.3 - Has AMD Improved?
snippet.description:
AMD recently released FSR 3.1, featuring improvement to both its spatial upscaler and frame generation. In this video, we're going to be focusing on the spatial side - stacking up the new FSR 3.1 against the prior 2.2 revision, before moving on to comparisons against DLSS 3.7 and XeSS 1.3. There are clear and obvious improvements, but it looks like FSR is still some way off the quality of its Nvidia and Intel counterparts.

snippet.title: DF Direct Weekly #170: VRR A Crutch For Good Console Perf? Auto SR Tested, Cerny Interview Reaction
snippet.description:
In the new DF Direct, the team discuss the growing importance of VRR in console gaming - but are we reaching the point where it's becoming essential for good performance? Meanwhile, Rich has some positive things to say about Microsoft's Auto SR upscaling technology, John has much to share on the new Crazy Taxi, and there are some interesting discussion points raised in a recent Mark Cerny interview. Meanwhile, what on Earth is going on with the latest Elden Ring patch notes?

snippet.title: DF Retro EX: Riven - An Adventure Classic Returns on PC & Meta Quest
snippet.description:
An adventure classic first launched in 1997, Cyan's Riven was built around pre-rendered imagery and full motion video, expertly utilising the CD-ROM format. And now, in 2024, Riven has returned, with Cyan's original vision fully realised in Unreal Engine 5 with beautiful real-time 3D. John revisits the classic and concentrates on what made it original and distinct, before checking out the remake in all of its glory on high-end PC, PC VR and the intriguing Meta Quest port.

localized.title: DF Retro EX: Riven - An Adventure Classic Returns on PC & Meta Quest
localized.description:
An adventure classic first launched in 1997, Cyan's Riven was built around pre-rendered imagery and full motion video, expertly utilising the CD-ROM format. And now, in 2024, Riven has returned, with Cyan's original vision fully realised in Unreal Engine 5 with beautiful real-time 3D. John revisits the classic and concentrates on what made it original and distinct, before checking out the remake in all of its glory on high-end PC, PC VR and the intriguing Meta Quest port.

snippet.title: Beyond Good & Evil 20th Anniversary Edition - PS5/Xbox/Switch Review - A Near Perfect Remaster?
snippet.description:
Developer Ubisoft gives its 2003 cult classic some much-needed attention - this time giving its textures and shaders a satisfying overhaul. PS5 and Series X also enjoy a boost to 4K resolution, on the resolution mode, while each run at 1440p on their performance modes. However the Switch release is less assured in its delivery, with expected cutbacks in its visuals - but also dips below the 30fps mark during gameplay - as Tom covers in this DF tech review.

snippet.title: Lossless Scaling: Frame Generation For Every Game - But How Good Is it?
snippet.description:
What if frame generation was available for every game and worked on Intel, Nvidia and AMD GPUs? And what if you could actually have TWO interpolated frames instead of just one? And how about some high quality scaling options included in the mix too? That's the pitch for Lossless Scaling - an inexpensive scaler with intriguing frame generation capabilities - so what's the quality level like? What are the benefits and drawbacks? And what are the best use-case scenarios? Alex Battaglia reports.

snippet.title: Dragon's Dogma 2 Patched: Big Improvements - But Is It Fully Fixed?
snippet.description:
UPDATE: Please check the pinned comment for a correction on the high/low preset. The low preset reduces resolution. Apologies for the oversight.

Dragon's Dogma 2 is now onto Patch 7, promising new graphics options, 120Hz support for PlayStation 5 and much-needed CPU optimisations - but what does that look like in the actual game? Oliver Mackenzie takes a look, finding that the improvements are genuine with most of our suggestions for the game taken onboard to a certain extent - but it's still far from perfect.

snippet.title: DF Direct Weekly #169: Dragon's Dogma 2 Fixed? FSR 3.1 First Look, Dead Rising Remake
snippet.description:
In the latest DF Direct Weekly, we take a very early first look at FSR 3.1's improved spatial upscaling, which 'dropped' just prior to recording. The team discuss Capcom's reveal of a NEW Dead Rising remaster/remake, while we have first impressions on a potentially game-changing patch for Dragon's Dogma 2. And just why is PlayStation 5 so technically competitive with Xbox Series X, despite having less horsepower? It's been a mystery for years, but we may finally have some answers.

snippet.title: Asus ROG Ally X Hands-On vs Asus ROG Ally - What's New & What It Means For Gaming
snippet.description:
Digital Foundry is sponsored by MSI's new range of next-gen QD OLED gaming monitors. Learn more about these displays here: https://msi.gm/MSI-QD-OLEDs

The Asus ROG Ally was the first Zen 4/RDNA 3 handheld, delivering superior performance vs Steam Deck - and now, there's a ROG Ally X. The same core processor and display remain, but virtually everything else has improved - with a doubling of battery capacity and a bump to 24GB of LPDDR5X delivering an improved experience. Rich has been hands-on and this is his report.

snippet.title: Introducing Auto Expanding Layers - GIMP 2.99.18 Update
snippet.description:
GIMP 2.99.18 now has "auto-expanding layers," a highly useful Paint tool feature that expands your layer automatically as you paint outside the layer boundary. Digital painters will love this feature as it keeps your paint strokes from being chopped off while you paint. Auto-expanding layers is one of many exciting new features that rolled out with GIMP 2.99.18, the latest development release version and last version prior to GIMP 3.0 release candidates. 

GIMP is a free photo editor most similar to Photoshop.

Watch the full What's New in GIMP 2.99.18 tutorial:
https://youtu.be/t0bpGdpBvvw

snippet.title: GIMP Gets Smart Guides! GIMP 2.99.18 Update
snippet.description:
GIMP finally gets smart guides, which allows users to see a "dynamic guide" on their canvas to align different layers as they move objects around. This feature is introduced with GIMP 2.99.18, the latest development release version and the last version before GIMP 3.0 release candidates start coming out. It's exciting times for GIMP, the free photo editor!

snippet.title: GIMP Non-Destructive Editing First Look (GIMP 2.99.18 Update)
snippet.description:
Non-destructive editing is finally here in GIMP! Check out this first look, which demonstrates how you can now add photo edits or effects to an image/layer in GIMP without affecting the original pixels of the image/layer. In other words, you can go back at ANY time any edit the effect you applied to your image. This feature has been long-requested and has been available in other software like Affinity Photo and Photoshop for years.

Check out the full video on What's New in GIMP 2.99.18:
https://youtu.be/t0bpGdpBvvw

snippet.title: What's New in GIMP 2.99.18 - Non-Destructive Editing is Here.
snippet.description:
Non-destructive editing is here! GIMP 2.99.18 introduces non-destructive editing, smart guides (known as "dynamic guides") and other smart snapping features, a new "Welcome Dialogue," and more! This is an important development release version because it is likely the LAST release prior to GIMP 3.0 release candidates and the final stable GIMP 3.0 release.  

Non-destructive editing means you can now make photo adjustments or add layer effects to a layer or image without directly applying the effect to that layer's pixels. You can then go back at any time and edit the effects, thus making your workflow much more flexible. 

0:00 - Intro & Resources
0:05 - Where to Download Development Releases
0:10 - New Welcome Dialogue
1:01 - New Personalize Tab for Customizing UI
6:39 - New Create Tab for Creating New Image
8:58 - Introducing Non-Destructive Editing in GIMP
14:02 - New Dynamic Guides (Smart Guides)
17:15 - New Auto-Expanding Layers Feature
19:40 - Improved Color Handling with Space Invasion
20:39 - Additional New Features
21:56 - Final Thoughts

snippet.title: Customize Your Site Icon (Favicon) in WordPress for 2024!
snippet.description:
Learn how to change the site icon for your WordPress website when using a block theme (i.e. the "Twenty Twenty-Four" theme). This beginner-friendly tutorials walks you step-by-step through the process of changing your "favicon" or site icon to customize the look of your website in your browser. The site icon is the little icon that appears in the browser tab when you have a website open.

WordPress is a free and open source content management platform that makes it easy to design websites without coding.

snippet.title: How to Add a Drop Shadow in Inkscape (Beginners Tutorial)
snippet.description:
In this Inkscape tutorial, I show you how to add a drop shadow to text and objects using a built-in drop shadow filter. I also show you how versatile this tool can be by adding multiple drop shadow effects to a single object, plus non-destructively editing text and the drop shadow filter after applying the effect. This is a great way to enhance your vector graphics or designs!

Inkscape is a free scalable vector graphics editor most similar to Adobe Illustrator and Affinity Design. 

Visit our website for more text and video tutorials:
https://www.daviesmediadesign.com/inkscape-tutorials/

Enroll in Our GIMP Photo Editing Masterclass:
https://www.udemy.com/course/gimp-photo-editing/?referralCode=418C294E695EA3962465

Enroll in My WordPress Course on Udemy:
https://www.udemy.com/course/wordpress-for-non-coders/?referralCode=741F8EC9A81CC573F41A

0:00 - Intro
0:15 - Add Drop Shadow Filter to Object
0:32 - Blur Radius Slider
1:05 - Horizontal Offset Slider
1:43 - Vertical Offset Slider
2:04 - Blur Color Tab (Change the Drop Shadow Color)
3:49 - Apply the Drop Shadow Effect
4:13 - Add a Second Drop Shadow
4:44 - Add a Drop Shadow to Text
5:19 - Shadow Types
6:03 - Drop Shadow Non-Destructive Editing (Filter Editor)
8:18 - Remove or Delete Drop Shadow Effect
8:32 - Final Thoughts

snippet.title: How to Compress Images for WordPress Using GIMP (Reduce File Sizes by Over 95%)
snippet.description:
In this tutorial I show you how to compress images for your WordPress website to decrease image file sizes and improve your page load speeds. I use GIMP, the free photo editor, to crop the aspect ratio, scale the image, and save the image to a compressed filetype. The methods discussed in this video will reduce the size of your images by over 95% without resulting in a noticeable loss in image quality. Your images will be much smaller but will still look great!

0:00 - Intro
0:15 - Open Image Into GIMP
0:38 - Change the Aspect Ratio with the Crop Tool
1:40 - Reduce Your Image Size with the Scale Tool
3:05 - Compress Your Image by Saving As a WebP File
4:46 - Upload Your Compressed Image to WordPress
5:10 - Final Thoughts and Resources

Visit our website for more text and video tutorials:
https://www.daviesmediadesign.com/tutorials/

snippet.title: New Evermotion 3D Trees Collection for Arch-viz - Archmodels vol. 283
snippet.description:
Archmodels vol. 283 collection includes 56 high-quality models of spring trees typical of European and American biomes that will allow you to create photorealistic visualizations of spring exteriors. The collection includes 14 species each specie is reproduced in 4 variants. All trees have materials applied and are ready to render. 

You can download this collection here: https://evm.link/am283

Included trees species: Alnus Ruba, White Elm, Junglans Amajor, Quercus Robur, Willow Weeping, Japanese Adler, Green Ash, Pinus ponderosa, Grand Fir Abies Grandis, Tricolor Beech, Western Hemlock, Black Locusts, Platanus Acerifolia, Live Oak.

snippet.title: Just draw your gardens! - Baga Grove Features Reel
snippet.description:
Scattering has nver been more intuitive! Draw entire gardens and green areas in seconds. This GeoPack, created in partnership with Baga Pie developer, offers a refreshing twist on traditional scattering techniques. Simply draw where you desire assets to be placed, no complex setup required.

Buy in Evermotion Shop: https://evm.link/bagagrove
Buy in Blender Market:  https://evm.link/bagagroveb

- Assets automatically arrange themselves to produce realistic groves, with smaller assets naturally situating at the edges and larger ones in the center.
- Additionally, you have the ability to create and save your own Groves using the BagaPie GeoPack system.

snippet.description:
Discover 10 essential mixing tips every producer should know. Whether you're a beginner or a seasoned pro, these tips will streamline your workflow and elevate your mixes.

Check out iZotope's music Production Suite 6.5:
https://www.izotope.com/en/products/music-production-suite.html/?utm_source=youtube&utm_medium=social&utm_campaign=organic&utm_content=youtube+organic_organic_10+mix+tips+producers+should+know

Mixing in Mono:
https://youtu.be/ku2-PkFKb3I?si=zgego70wMFSR4aAs

0:00 Intro
0:37  1 - Know your monitoring environment
3:01  2 - Edit and clean up your tracks before mixing
4:10  3 - Prep your session and create a static mix
5:16  4 - Learn the three dimensions of your mix
6:50  5 - Use reference tracks
7:41  6 - Listen in context to make space for your tracks
9:08  7 - Reference your mixes in mono
10:15  8 - EQ your effects
10:56  9 - Mix with intention
11:43  10 - Look after your wellbeing

#iZotope

snippet.title: KDP University @home with Rachel McLean
snippet.description:
2021 Kindle Storyteller award winner Rachel McLean is known for her best-selling Detective Zoe Finch and Dorset Crime series. In January 2022, McLean’s releasing her new book 5 Steps to Author Success, which chronicles her journey from sporadic sales to her current success.

On December 16, Rachel joined us to share her story, selecting appropriate genres, and how she integrates reader expectations into her writing to increase sales.

snippet.title: Kindle Vella: A new way to tell a story
snippet.description: Kindle Vella is a new storytelling option from Kindle Direct Publishing to self-publish serialized stories, one short episode at a time. This presentation will share details about Kindle Vella, how to publish a story, and best practices to maximize your success with this new option.

snippet.title: Premio Literario Amazon Storyteller 2021  Ceremonia
snippet.description: Ceremonia de entrega del Premio Literario Amazon Storyteller 2021. Una sesión virtual presentada por los conocidos escritores Lorena Franco y Fernando Gamboa en la que se anuncia el título ganador de la edición de este año. También participan varios autores KDP para compartir consejos y sugerencias sobre como construir una carrera literaria a través de la autopublicación.

También participan varios autores KDP para compartir consejos y sugerencias sobre como construir una carrera literaria a través de la autopublicación.

snippet.title: KDP University @home with Michaelbrent Collings
snippet.description:
Novelist and  screenwriter Michaelbrent Collings is one of the most successful indie horror authors in the US, as well as an international best-selling thriller, fantasy, science fiction, and mystery writer. His works have been nominated for Bram Stoker, Dragon, and RONE awards.
Collings is a frequent guest at comic cons and writing podcasts like Six Figure Authors, The Creative Penn, Writing Excuses, and more. 
On October 28, Collings shared with us how writing helped him gain a whole new sense of hope and how branding and event attendance can build your readership.

snippet.title: KDP University @home with Sarina Bowen
snippet.description: Sarina Bowen, formerly a Wall Street trader, is the award-winning author of over thirty contemporary- and LGBT-romance novels. Her books have hit USA Today’s best-seller list nineteen times , have been published in over a dozen languages, and are sold on five continents. Bowen joined us on September 30 to share how she went from Wall Street to writer, along with her best tips for pricing your books and writing series.

snippet.title: Amazon KDP Detail Page Linking
snippet.description:
This video explains how you can link your eBook, paperback, and hardcover books together into a single Amazon product detail page. You'll learn how KDP automates this process and what to do if the linking doesn't happen automatically. 

For more information, visit our Help article: https://kdp.amazon.com/help/topic/G200652220

snippet.title: KDP University @home with Michelle M. Pillow
snippet.description:
A romantic at heart, Michelle M. Pillow loves stories with a happy ending, imperfect characters, and good mysteries that are challenging to solve. Though she writes in many genres—and has sold a million books across them!—she’s best known for her sci-fi and paranormal romances, mysteries, and paranormal women's fiction. On September 16, Pillow shared with us phenomenal marketing tips, including how she uses resources like Author Central and A+ content to create a strong book release.


Check out Michelle's blog for the tips she discusses in the webinar: https://michellepillow.com/amazon-kdp-university-with-michelle-m-pillow/. We are including this link for informational purposes only; Amazon does not endorse or sponsor any service provider, nor recommend one over another. This information is to help you find what works best for you.

snippet.title: KDP University @home with Andrew Watts
snippet.description: In 2012, while deployed on a USS Navy aircraft carrier, Andrew Watts took up writing as a way to occupy his free time. Fast-forward nearly a decade and Watts is now the owner of Severn River Publishing, which has published titles for over 20 authors. Drawing on his experience in the military and working in brand management for one of the world’s largest consumer-goods companies, Watts uses his discipline and marketing acumen to turn his projects into reality as a successful author and business owner. On September 2, Watts joined us to share his top tips for starting and growing your career as an indie author—from his unique perspective on both sides of the pen.

snippet.title: MUSIC MAKER 2025 PREMIUM: The New Multimode Filter + 3-Band EQ
snippet.description:
Need the perfect drop? The new Multimode Filter makes it easy to cut out low frequencies when you need to create tension, and then bring them back with a bang. In this video, we delve into the latest version of MAGIX Video Pro X, highlighting its new features and improvements. From enhanced stability to a faster workflow, discover how the core updates contribute to the editing of complex content projects.

🍻 BUY US A BEER WITH PATREON!🍻

Thanks to our Patrons who made this possible - your names are at the end of the video. You make a huge difference!

This piece was made using a whole load of MIDI code and synth generators to make a musical scene that generated itself. This is NOT AI generation - it was made entirely by myself.
The accompanying video scene however was generated by Photoshop, then animated by Pika - the focus of this piece in my opinion though is the audio and not the video.
If anyone knows a cool animator who'd like to make a video piece to go along with the audio instead of the generated picture, let me know.

snippet.title: Random Hangout - Live Vocal Editing, Q&A, Etc
snippet.description:
EDIT: Sorry about the low volume at the beginning of the video. This was resolved somewhere around the 53 minute mark or so

➡️ Check out my "Drum Editing in REAPER" course on Pro Mix Academy!
https://bit.ly/3DfFgww

Today,we'll be comping and editing the vocals we tracked on the last live stream. This will be for the original song "When Are We Leaving" by my band Midlife Riot
  @MidlifeRiot-qi7yf 

Check out our last release, "Blue Drift"
https://youtu.be/RijfkY_1OGY?si=oBiDv2lGPXcYO8N_

Let's hang out for a bit. Bring your questions, smash that like button, subscribe if you're new, feel free to drop some cash if you'd like by using the Super Thanks button, and of course, come join us on Discord!

snippet.title: Gate Crasher: Removing Distractions for Better Images with Scott Kelby (Blind Photo Edits)
snippet.description:
Join Scott Kelby and Erik Kuna in this excerpt from The Grid’s episode "How Would I Edit Your Photo," where they walk you through editing a lighthouse photo taken with an iPhone. Learn how to remove unwanted objects like gates and telephone poles using Photoshop’s powerful tools. Whether you're a beginner or looking to expand your editing skills, this tutorial will help you create cleaner, more captivating images.

Watch the full episode of The Grid Photography Podcast here:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HdzdZ5ggI_I&t=2s

snippet.title: National Parks: A Photographer's Guide to the Great Smoky Mountains with Richard Bernabe
snippet.description: Get to know the Great Smoky Mountains National Park! Join Richard Bernabe for an in-depth photographer’s guide to this amazing and very accessible national park. From cool flowing water to scenic vistas and historic cabins, the Great Smoky Mountains has an unending supply of photogenic spots that are easily accessible by car or short hikes. In this class, Richard shares his tips and techniques for photographing moving water, sunrises and sunsets, historic landmarks, and much more! By the end of the class, you’ll have a new appreciation for where to go and what to photograph in this beautiful park. Link to class: https://kel.by/3W1cfiY

snippet.title: Safari Photography in a Wildlife Park with Rick Sammon
snippet.description: Grab your favorite sun hat and get ready to head out on safari! Join Rick Sammon at Fossil Rim Wildlife Center for an up close and personal game drive where you’ll learn what gear to bring, tips for composition, the importance of learning about your subjects, how to prepare for a drive through a game park, and some of Rick’s favorite Photoshop enhancements to make your photos look their best. Rick encounters a host of wildlife typically found in Africa and shares important and easy-to-remember techniques to help you get the most out of your experience. Link to class: https://kel.by/4cttkYH

snippet.title: "Stupid mistakes and the big stupid head that made them!" (Me) with Scott Kelby | The Grid Ep 608
snippet.description:
Scott and Erik share a video from instructor Jefferson Graham with tips for iPhone/Android fireworks photography, and share their own tips for great fireworks shots. Then special guest Claire Jones chats with Scott about the "Shuttleworth Festival of Flight" airshow they attended, and they showcase some of her shots from the event. Scott 'fesses up to some terrible mistakes he made. If it can happen to Scott it can happen to anybody!

RELATED COURSES
https://members.kelbyone.com/course/gbiderman-night-photography-techniques/
https://members.kelbyone.com/course/erik-kuna-creative-techniques-airshow-photography/

HIGHLIGHTS
▶  Put something in your foreground and that really looks cool when you have that long exposure. And then you've got something really sharp in your foreground. It really takes it to that next level. 

▶  Use bulb mode! Most cameras have bulb mode. It means leave the shutter open until I close it.

ABOUT THE GRID PHOTOGRAPHY PODCAST
The Grid is a live talk show about photography, Photoshop, and other industry-related topics. Each week features a different guest (in-studio or online), and viewers are encouraged to chime in on the Liveblog here on KelbyOne.com or via Twitter by adding #TheGridLive to their tweets.
Visit: https://kelbyone.com/
 
ABOUT SCOTT KELBY
Scott is a photographer, award-winning author, and the original "Photoshop Guy," as well as the CEO of KelbyOne, an online educational community for Photographers, Photoshop, and Lightroom users.
 
ABOUT ERIK KUNA
Driven by a passion for creating inspiring images, I work with artists and media focused on creating photos, animations, motion art, and videos that communicate the story and capture the beauty, wonder, and amazement of space exploration.
"The value of beauty and inspiration is very much underrated, no question." -Elon Musk.
The greatest gift we can give humanity today is to look beyond our current generation to the future of space exploration. Democratizing space for everyone, the next frontier for all of us to explore.

ABOUT CLAIRE JONES
UK-based professional Rugby photographer

snippet.title: Simi Ritch, Senior Technical Manager – IT Service Management | Life @ OCLC
snippet.description:
Simi Ritch helps ensure our products and services are at their very best when we roll them out for our customers. She is also a constant source of fun and positivity, which is evident in her love for libraries, racing, and cookies.

Want to be part of the part of OCLC’s technology with a purpose? Learn more about the impacts we make, our company culture, and available career opportunities here: https://oc.lc/careers
 
---------------------
 
Life @ OCLC: We are librarians, technologists, researchers, pioneers, leaders, and learners. With thousands of library members in more than 100 countries, we come together as OCLC to make information more accessible and more useful. Our people make us special. We make it easier and faster for people to access the world’s knowledge, and we create a thriving culture that enables us to deliver on our inspiring mission.

snippet.title: Introducing the "Library Collaboration as a Strategic Choice" OCLC Research report
snippet.description:
In this short video, Brian Lavoie, Senior Research Scientist, introduces the OCLC Research report he authored, "Library Collaboration as a Strategic Choice: Evaluating Options for Acquiring Capacity."

This report explores library collaboration as a key strategy for academic libraries in acquiring needed capacity, but also contextualizes it as one sourcing approach among a range of options available to libraries. You'll come away with insights and resources that can help your academic library think about whether and how to choose collaborative options that meet your strategic goals.
 
➡️ Download and read the full report here: http://oc.lc/strategic-collaboration

snippet.title: Transforming metadata
snippet.description:
Library metadata is transforming. Our creation process and supply chains are evolving, and new architectures are emerging. OCLC and library stakeholders are showing that linking data across isolated systems and services will enhance the user experience, allowing efficiencies across the value chain. This transformation is key to achieving important library goals, such as multilingualism to support equity, diversity, and inclusion principles. 

OCLC staff and library metadata experts explore changes taking place: the transition to linked data and identifiers, the description of inside-out and facilitated collections, and the evolution of metadata as a service, as well as resulting staffing requirements.

snippet.title: UberSoftLightKit_02
snippet.description: 2 of 2 Instructional videos covering the parameters and controls of the Uber Soft Light Kit.  This video delves in the controls of the "Uber Soft Distant" and "Uber Soft Point" lights in the kit.  These lights allow for pseudo area lights via light wrapping controls as well as advanced falloff controls via custom light shaders for DAZ Studio.

These lights allow for pseudo area lights via light wrapping controls as well as advanced falloff controls via custom light shaders for DAZ Studio.

Peculiar Sounds V2 is here, bringing groundbreaking features and unparalleled creativity to your fingertips. Whether you’re a seasoned producer or just starting out, V2 is designed to inspire and elevate your music to new heights.

Key Features:

Standalone Mode
Run Peculiar Sounds V2 independently from any DAW. Perfect for live performances at church, weddings, or any gig, standalone mode ensures you have your sounds ready wherever you go.
Enhanced Layering Capabilities

Our advanced layering system allows you to blend up to two sounds, creating rich and complex textures. This feature is now the core of V2, providing endless creative possibilities. We’ve collaborated with the legendary Doobie Powell to sample and create hundreds of new patches that will blow you away.

Innovative MIDI Browser
Jumpstart your creativity with our comprehensive MIDI browser. It includes hundreds of chord progressions, melodies, and drum loop MIDI files that you can drag directly into your DAW, streamlining your workflow and sparking inspiration.

New Effects: Lowfizer and Mod Filter
Meet the needs of the most creative producers with our two new innovative effects:

Lowfizer: Instantly create lofi vibes with the touch of a button and the turn of a knob. Perfect for adding that nostalgic, gritty sound to your tracks.
Mod Filter: A special filter freak that adds dynamic movement and flow to any sound. Ideal for creating evolving soundscapes and intricate textures.

Game-Changing Arpeggiator
Our powerful arpeggiator lets you craft intricate, evolving patterns with ease. Add dynamic movement and complexity to your tracks, whether you’re working on melodies, basslines, or rhythmic textures.

Sounds Off The Block Expansion
Now included for free, the Sounds Off The Block expansion brings the total to over 400 patches. This expansion is packed with inspiring sounds that will elevate your productions to new heights.

snippet.title: The first Bluetooth editing controller - A quick review of TourBox Elite
snippet.description:
Back the Kickstarter: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/toutbox/tourbox-elite-the-ultimate-bluetooth-controller-for-creators
The Tourbox Elite is an unparalleled Bluetooth editing controller, engineered for digital content producers. I created my own custom preset specifically for Blender, and then put it to the test. Controls were easy to adjust, and working wirelessly is such a joy!
The kickstarter campaign ends December 24th 2021. There are serious savings to be had by grabbing the Tourbox before it gets officially released next year.

localized.title: Ben Mauro - Sculpting Primates in ZBrush
localized.description:
A condensed version of one of my older tutorials that i thought would be useful for people. I included the comparative anatomy lecture at the beginning also. Anyone wanting a more detailed/realtime explanation of everything, the 4 hour version is available on my gumroad along with all the project files. Happy sculpting! 

https://gum.co/PRIMATEBUNDLE

snippet.title: INKTOBER 2018: Blender + Photoshop Sketches / Experiments / Studies
snippet.description:
A couple sketches, studies, experiments from Inktober this year, trying to make an effort to post more videos now and then, hopefully wont be another 2 years before the next one! The first sketch of the Cobra was trying out some of Jama's Blender Greasepencil techniques to try to use as a blockout method before going into Photoshop for a more detailed line-drawing, still not 100% comfortable drawing in 3D yet. I condensed this part down a bit, if you want a full on tutorial for Blender/Grease Pencil definitely check out Jama's tutorials here, he goes over everything in detail: https://gumroad.com/jamajurabaev

The truck sketch was just straight drawing in Photoshop without any blender/3D stuff. The last image was a design i did earlier that started as a stratos zero study that turned into a more sci-fi looking design, this was also just all 2D, i didnt record the process but thought i would include a few steps from the rough sketch to final of that one. Enjoy!

snippet.title: Business/Art/Life Part 1
snippet.description:
Update: https://gumroad.com/benmaurodesign I added the rates section to the Gumroad version of the talk, so anyone that buys that version gets a little extra content (3-4 mins), i was planning to have that be the start of Part 2 but i need to put it on hold for a while to get some projects finished but wanted to make sure the rates section was out there in some form for now. You can also view this information in text form on my website in the advice section: http://benmaurodesign.com/Advice

A collection of thoughts and experiences from working in the entertainment industry, basically the sort of talk i wish someone gave to me before i started working. I hope this is useful to you all and helps you on your journey.

snippet.title: Ben Mauro - ZBrush for Environments
snippet.description:
In this video i go over the creation of a mech hanger set design in ZBrush using elements blocked out for my Massive Black workshop demo last year to construct a larger scene and render out compositions using Keyshot in order to do a detailed environment production painting in Photoshop that could be used for a next gen game or film. I go over the creation of the set and taking different shots before deciding on a final story moment and composition to refine in Photoshop to sell the idea to our imaginary client/director. Hope you enjoy the Doge, thanks for watching!

For more tutorials and resources from me, check out my gumroad:
https://gumroad.com/benmaurodesign#

Here was a link to James Paick's tutorial i was talking about:
http://www.conceptdesignworkshop.com/james-paick-vol1

Scott Robertson's Perspective and Matte Surface Shading tutorials:
http://cargocollective.com/drawthrough/DVDs

Here was a link to Vitaly's kitbash parts:
http://vitalybulgarov.com/3d-kitbash/

snippet.title: Ben Mauro - YUKON PIT CREW: PART 1
snippet.description:
Collab between myself and Vaughan Ling (HEAVYPOLY), going over a first design pass of a possible humanoid type character in the same aesthetic as his YUKON creature which could be part of pit crew team for some future racing event. 

Future videos could go over refinement of the character/tools they might use to service the YUKON creatures during repairs etc. as we go back and forth defining the world that Vaughan has in mind. Could also go over the building of the final 3D models and scene before 3D printing, and showing the final collectible design when its all wrapped up if you guys are interested, let me know in the comments. ;)

If you are interested in a 3D print of the YUKON design give Vaughan an email at: Heavypoly@gmail.com so he can get an idea of how many to print later on down the line which would be available through HEAVYPOLY Industries. 

For more badass stuff from Vaughan Ling check out his site:
http://www.heavypoly.com/

For more work from myself check out my personal site at:
http://www.benmaurodesign.com/

snippet.title: Ben Mauro - Future Soldier Photobash
snippet.description:
Production painting technique using photos as a base to produce detailed concept art quickly. We used this approach on most of our ELYSIUM art to generate multiple finished ideas each day. Trying to keep this in line with some of the other primate mech's i have been doing lately, though this guy would barely qualify as a 'light' trooper. Might take a crack at a heavy version in a cooler pose that has way more bulky/integrated exo-skeleton tech, would help give off more of the 'Gorilla' vibe in its overall proportion and stance, maybe for a future video if you guys are into this stuff? Let me know, enjoy the video!

More of my work here: http://www.artofben.com/

If you would like to get a more in depth look into other production techniques check out some of my more in-depth tutorials here: https://gumroad.com/benmaurodesign#

snippet.title: Secret After Effects Features, Blender MoGraph Tools, Half-Rez Returns | Motion Mondays
snippet.description:
Our summer session has STARTED! But there is still time to jump in during orientation week. Register  by Thursday 7/11 and  lock in our current prices before they go up next session: schoolofmotion.com/summerschool

See the corresponding blog post to this video here: https://www.schoolofmotion.com/blog/motion-mondays-july-8-2024

Kyle Webster, Adobe's brush master, makes a surprising move to Procreate. Blender users get a MoGraph boost with new tools rivaling Cinema 4D. Plus, Half-Rez 2024 is announced, promising another epic gathering for motion designers in Chicago.

We also explore viral VFX tactics, Womp's new 3D asset library, and the emergence of Pikimov, a free web-based animation tool that takes aim at After Effects. Don't miss updates on Blender 4.2 LTS, ElevenLabs' Voice Isolator, and Luma AI's Dream Machine’s new keyframing feature.

snippet.title: Create Realistic Fire with Unreal Engine with Niagara Fluids!
snippet.description:
Harness the power of Niagara fluids to create fast, ultra-realistic fire in Unreal! 
Don’t forget to download the project (Unreal 5.4) files here: https://www.schoolofmotion.com/blog/fire-in-unreal-engine

In this tutorial, Aharon Rabinowitz does a deep dive into Niagara fluids, showing you how to easily create realistic fire in Unreal Engine for use in motion graphics and VFX. You’ll learn how to apply a simple Niagara preset and quickly build on it to create flaming text, objects, logos and animated characters. Be prepared to flex your particle simulation muscles - and get ready to feel the burn! 

Want to learn Unreal from the ground up. Check out our course Unreal Engine for 3D artists here: https://www.schoolofmotion.com/courses/unreal-engine-for-3d-artists

CHAPTERS
Intro 00:00:00
Man Creates Fire 00:00:59
Playing With Fire 00:04:36
Using Fire with Text 00:14:00
Offsetting The Particles 00:23:14
Animating Fire On & Off 00:26:13
How to Add Particles to an Animated Character 00:41:08
Explosions 00:47:19
Cool Applications of The Niagara Fluid System 00:52:40:01

Follow Aharon:
Twitter: https://x.com/ABAOProductions
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/aharonrabinowitz/

snippet.title: Melodyne essential • Pitch correction basics

In this video, Rich covers all the basic editing techniques you can perform with Melodyne essential (and then, of course, with the larger Melodyne editions as well). Using a beautiful, very bluesy and soulful vocal performance as an example, he also discusses how far good editing may go and when – sometimes – less is more.

snippet.title: More guitar editing tricks in Melodyne
snippet.description:
Want more tips for creative guitar editing in Melodyne? Here you go! In today’s video, Sensho uses the polyphonic editing capabilities (aka DNA) of Melodyne editor and Melodyne studio. 

Need to fix individual notes in guitar chords? Melodyne’s unique polyphonic Copy and Replace function will solve the most complex repair challenges in your guitar recordings. Annoyed by squeaky frets? Sensho shows how to reduce fret noise on an acoustic guitar while maintaining a completely natural overall sound. Need more control over your funky guitar? Try shaping the envelopes of each note with Melodyne. Or have fun with some more envelope shaping on a plucked single-note guitar. Ever wished the guitarist had used less (or more) of the wah-wah pedal during the recording? No problem: learn how to reduce or increase this effect after the fact. There’s so much Melodyne can offer to your creativity.

Guitarists and producers alike: enjoy!

0:00 Intro
0:09 Fixing individual notes in chords
1:49 Reducing fret noise
4:49 Envelope shaping: funk guitar
6:23 More envelope shaping: single-note guitar
6:54 Treating a wah-wah effect in Melodyne

snippet.title: Creative guitar editing with Melodyne
snippet.description:
Alright, guitar players. Today, Sensho is covering some of the creative uses of Melodyne for getting unique guitar sounds, saving time and staying inspired! Learn how to add guitar swells to simulate a volume pedal, create stacks and layers for a fuller sound, and sculpt your guitar tone with Melodyne studio's Sound Editor.

00:00 Intro
00:12 Simulating a volume pedal using the Fade tool (with Melodyne assistant or higher)
02:26 Creating stacks and layers with individual deviations in pitch and timing (with Melodyne editor or higher)
04:36 Individual tweaking of formants per layer (with Melodyne assistant or higher)
06:05 More duplicates with extra octaves for bigger sound (all Melodyne editions)
07:17 Sculpting the guitar sound with Melodyne studio’s Sound Editor
10:41 Outro

snippet.title: Vocal editing with Melodyne assistant. Part 2: Further optimizations
snippet.description:
In this video, Rich demonstrates the benefits of upgrading from Melodyne essential to assistant, which comes with 15 new tools that will take your vocal editing to a fully professional level. 

This is Part 2 of a small series, the first video of which (see https://youtu.be/_K15qETAitk) covered the basics of tuning and timing optimization using some of the highly specialized tools. And here in Part 2, Rich provides great musical examples of what all the other new tools do and how to use them skilfully.

While this video is primarily aimed at users of Melodyne essential, even experienced users of one of the higher editions of Melodyne (i.e. Melodyne editor or Melodyne studio) should take a look. We bet there's always something you can learn from Rich! 

See also here for a comparison chart of all four Melodyne editions:
https://www.celemony.com/en/melodyne/melodyne-5-editions#7223

0:00 Intro
0:32 Controlling the sibilant balance
1:44 How (and why) to toggle sibilant handling on/off
2:35 Adding fades for a more relaxed feel and natural flow
3:48 Combining techniques for natural-sounding longer notes
5:52 How adding separations allows for more focus on specific words
9:30 The phrasing within a blob
12:29 Adding multiple time handles for vibrato control
13:25 Formants: what they are and why you might want to change them

snippet.title: Vocal editing with Melodyne assistant. Part 1: First moves
snippet.description:
Melodyne assistant comes with some powerful tools for vocal editing. Let Rich show you how these tools enable a truly professional workflow.

This first of a small series of videos covers the editing of pitch and timing in vocals. In Melodyne assistant, you have 6 specialized tools for that alone (instead of just one, as in Melodyne essential), and Rich gives great examples for all of them.

While this video is aimed primarily at users of Melodyne essential, the examples and detailed explanations that Rich shares here may provide valuable tips even if you already own any of the higher editions of Melodyne (i.e. Melodyne editor or Melodyne studio).

snippet.title: Melodyne • Quantizing multi-track drums
snippet.description:
Quantizing a multi-track recording is a bit like the supreme discipline an audio engineer can face. But no worries, Rich has made a video for you on this particular subject. Watch as he edits and quantizes the performance of a real drummer who’s been recorded on multiple tracks. Rich shows how to adapt the human touch to the machine and vice versa. The best part: he does it all without any phase issues while still keeping the original drum mics on separate channels for full flexibility in the final mix.

0:00 Intro
0:27 Proper setup and parameters
2:14 Why multi-track recordings are different

localized.title: Melodyne • Quantizing multi-track drums
localized.description:
Quantizing a multi-track recording is a bit like the supreme discipline an audio engineer can face. But no worries, Rich has made a video for you on this particular subject. Watch as he edits and quantizes the performance of a real drummer who’s been recorded on multiple tracks. Rich shows how to adapt the human touch to the machine and vice versa. The best part: he does it all without any phase issues while still keeping the original drum mics on separate channels for full flexibility in the final mix.

snippet.title: worm
snippet.description:
i've been thinking some nasty thoughts
brain got me crawling down deep in the dirt
the rain came down and flushed me into your life
now I'm wriggling at your feet, baby, praying that you feel this is right

would you love me if i was worm?
would you love me if i was worm?

would you love me if i was worm?
would you love me or leave me to burn
in the ground at your feet
I've never felt so complete
would you love me if i was worm?

snippet.title: Blackmagic Cloud Live Sync
snippet.description:
Today we announced Blackmagic Cloud Live Sync, a new feature of Blackmagic Cloud storage that allows a camera to sync media into a DaVinci Resolve bin while the camera is recording. Within seconds editors and colorists in post production facilities can see media arriving in real time and start editing and grading, even while the camera continues to record. This is a revolution in broadcast workflows where post productions artists can see and work with media, seconds after it's been recorded in a camera, from any location globally.

The secret to Blackmagic Cloud live sync is the ability of the latest Blackmagic cameras, such as the Cinema Camera 6K, PYXIS, URSA Cine and URSA Broadcast G2, to record a full resolution HD proxy in H.264. These files are live synced to Blackmagic Cloud as they are recorded, and then also live synced down to all DaVinci Resolve workstations that are connected to the same cloud project. All you need to do is connect to the project. It is all automatic!

The new Blackmagic Cloud live sync feature will be public beta in mid June as a free download for Blackmagic Cinema Camera 6K and Blackmagic URSA Broadcast G2, with updates for all cameras coming shortly after. This update to Blackmagic Cloud will be included free with current Blackmagic Cloud media sync plans. There will be no additional costs.

Live sync on Blackmagic Cloud with cameras recording live into a DaVinci Resolve bin will be demonstrated on the Blackmagic Design Cinegear 2024 booth #S5125. Learn more at https://www.blackmagicdesign.com/media/release/20240607-01

localized.title: Using LUTs with your Blackmagic Camera
localized.description:
Watch this video to learn how to add a custom LUT to your Blackmagic camera, how to apply it to the LCD or HDMI output and how LUTs work with your Blackmagic RAW and ProRes recorded files.

The latest camera software update can be downloaded for free from www.blackmagicdesign.com/support/family/professional-cameras

snippet.title: Behind the Scenes: Viva La Dirt League uses Blackmagic Design Multicam Workflow
snippet.description:
Viva La Dirt League, the international hit sketch comedy and table top gaming YouTube channel, is using a full Blackmagic Design multicam set up to shoot, complete post and stream their hit weekly Dungeons and Dragons (D&D) game. This workflow includes ATEM Television Studio HD8 ISO live production switchers, Studio Camera 6K Pro and Pocket Cinema Camera 6K Pro digital cameras and DaVinci Resolve editing, color grading, visual effects (VFX) and audio post production software.

Read the full story at https://www.blackmagicdesign.com/media/release/20231213-01

snippet.title: Behind the Scenes: Sarah Clark Streams her Art with Blackmagic Design
snippet.description:
Sarah Renae Clark’s hugely popular social media channels, aimed at transforming coloring pages into epic art, are created using ATEM Television Studio HD8 ISO live production switcher and Blackmagic Studio Camera 6K Pros. Blackmagic Cloud Store Mini 8TB network storage is also used to provide high speed access to multiple editors.

Read the full story at https://www.blackmagicdesign.com/media/release/20231212-01

snippet.title: Unsheathed Resolve | DillonGoo x Punishing: Gray Raven
snippet.description:
Only the sound of the snowstorm can be heard in the vast mountain peak. An unexpected figure has shown up before Lucia...

Come join us! Play as the Commandant of Gray Raven, and fight alongside your trusty comrades against the Punishing Virus via https://pgr.onelink.me/V3xI/d73jh201

You can also enjoy our official music show of the latest version Wintry Shackles via https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5Rt6h3Z7NFQ, and listen to Lucia: Crimson Weave's theme song in our Official Music Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tdguBV7ggSw
#punishinggrayraven #PGR #crimsonweaveGet

snippet.title: PROGENITOR: A Genshin Cyberpunk Anime // EPISODE 1 & 2
snippet.description:

As seen on HoYoFair !

snippet.title: Arturia Astrolab - Ok King
snippet.description:
*Subjective opinions within, those who do not understand subjective opinion may be excused lol*

SUPPORT THE CHANNEL AND GET YOUR GEAR WITH Zzounds EASY PAYMENT PLANS:
https://bit.ly/3zv9UhY

*100% music in this video composed/produced by me.

Remember, pick what's best for you, the Arturia Astrolab is an amazing piece of hardware, BUT, I've owned and played quite possibly every live keyboardists keyboard and so some of the things I say will seem knit picky, but the Astrolab I feel is positioned as the perfect hybrid... it's less aimed at the touring player, but more at the performer player/producer player... someone who is keen on hearing the magic of the studio on the stage.  

That said, yes, this is from a live players perspective, I'm not a journalist or enjoy being a highly technical reviewer, those videos will be available, as a musician this is from my POV as to what works and what doesn't   
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

snippet.title: Great Synth Mysteries Ep. 6: There will NEVER be another Access Virus
snippet.description:

SUPPORT THE CHANNEL AND GET YOUR GEAR WITH Zzounds EASY PAYMENT PLANS:
https://bit.ly/3zv9UhY

*100% music in this video composed/produced by me.

This is a love story about a synthesizer unlike many others, in my opinion a synth that came out so long ago still eclipses many releases of today.  Great Synth Mystery, mmm, maybe... but I wanted to make a compelling piece about such a wonderful instrument.  As a musician and not a reviewer or journalist I think this really speaks to how ahead of it's time the Access Virus Ti was.

snippet.title: How Old School Music Magazines LIED to us?
snippet.description:
*Subjective opinions within, those who do not understand subjective opinion may be excused lol*

SUPPORT THE CHANNEL AND GET YOUR GEAR WITH Zzounds EASY PAYMENT PLANS:
https://bit.ly/3zv9UhY

*100% music in this video composed/produced by me. (except Simpsons clip)

#1: This is an opinion piece done as a psudo love story and retrospective to music magazines of old.  When being asked to focus on the positive I questioned the motive of that publication as I'm a producer and musician, NOT a reviewer or journalist.  When looking back I was very much surprised to my findings, though, I probably shouldn't have been.  I tell stories, that's what I do, it's hard to be objective in any format, but I think that was their aim, to not really review something, but tell you about the features.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

TLDR: Over the last few years I completed my personal collection of Minifoogers, outside of the Ring Mod which I don't need another of.  So in this video I dive into a bit of the backstory of Minifooger pedals, I also have a Moogerfooger retrospective if you'd like to watch that.  I love these pedals very much, paired with a synthesizer or a guitar they're delicious sounding and their analog design pushes things forward in terms of sound scape.

snippet.title: Fell asleep in the sun ⌚️ #b3d
snippet.description:
I had this surreal idea of a robot with a body of an Apple Watch that could walk with stumpy AirPods legs. So here’s the animation I ended up making in Blender.

The idea was that the robot fell asleep in the sun, but the sun moved, so it needed to get back in the sun to keep charging!

How I made this: https://youtu.be/t0F2dTJoJ48

3D models:
AirPods Pro model by Polyman on Sketchfab

Apple Watch Series 9 model by Jackie&Design on Sketchfab

snippet.title: Animating a Robot Made out of Apple Parts
snippet.description:
Let's take some detailed 3D models of Apple parts and turn them into a quadruped robot!

https://patreon.com/polyfjord
https://instagram.com/polyfjord
https://discord.gg/polyfjord
https://youtube.com/@Polyfjord2

AirPods Pro model by Polyman on Sketchfab:
https://sketchfab.com/3d-models/airpods-pro-with-magsafe-charging-case-ios15-52e5f28b37f94f05b6c0768773137689

Update: Unfortunately the artist that modelled the Apple Watch Series 9 model has deleted their Sketchfab account, but here is a similar downloadable model: https://sketchfab.com/3d-models/apple-watch-series-9-b6d698e718bb425a97057767f0cede47

00:00 Intro
00:29 Importing 3D models
01:14 Outlining the shape
02:30 Rigging
03:43 Modeling the leg joints
09:05 Animating the rig
11:06 Figuring out the concept
11:48 Adding textures and lights
14:37 Adding gobo lighting
15:14 Animating the watch screen
16:00 Additional tweaks
16:51 Final result!
17:17 Thanks for watching!
