snippet.title: History of AI
snippet.description:
We'll look at how AI has evolved and examine how its expectations and predictions have changed over the years.

Submit your questions anytime https://www.askofficehours.global
Join our global community https://officehours.global

00:00 Intro
00:20:00 Across the history of the research and development of machine learning and "artificial intelligence" , when was the problem of "explainability" recognized and what strategies have been put forward for solving this important problem?
00:30:40 When was machine learning replaced with AI? Is many services marketed as AI really just machine learning?
00:34:08 The Logic Theorist was an early program designed to mimic the problem solving skills of a human. What software do you regularly use that mimics human thinking or just seems to understand you?
00:38:51 Given the increasing role of AI in various industries, how can individuals safely and effectively learn AI skills, particularly in the context of prompt-based learning versus using prompt generators? What are the potential advantages and limitations
00:41:41 We’ve seen more than one “AI winter” - do we feel another is coming in the near future?
00:48:41 Does a machine need to store results internally to be considered intelligent or can the results and programs depend on their human keepers for storage? Early computational machines had no storage.
00:50:10 Humans create tools to solve problems. "AI" technology, including LLMs, are tools. The more complex the tool, the more careful we need to be to set explicit expectations, requirements, and limits on the tool's use. Please reflect on this?
00:53:59 Can you think of early examples of science fiction dealing with the concept of AI? I recall the 1960's episode of Star Trek where Landru, a computer programmed by its creator, was used to run an entire blissfully unaware society.
00:55:55 How does the "Chinese Room" problem inform your understanding of past, current, and future "AI" technology?
00:58:06 One barrier to making genAI a true "companion" for daily life are the rate limits imposed by the current platform operators. (I've run into this with Claude myself.) Do you think that will become less of an issue over time?
00:59:55 Anthropic has extended into the government market including potential use for "providing warning in advance of potential military activities, opening a window for diplomacy to prevent or deter them." Will we get to a point where AI can do that?

snippet.title: Design Success in Turbulent, Ambiguous Spaces
snippet.description:
Speaker: Chris Avore

Design teams and organizations are confronting rarely-seen degrees of turbulence, unpredictability, ambiguity, and complexity today. Generational trends and macro-economic forces are creating a pressure-cooker for business and design leaders where every decision can seemingly save or sink the company.

But there are techniques and approaches design leaders can deploy consistently with their business, product, and engineering partners, and within their design teams, that can improve your odds for success. This talk will explore those approaches by examining the role of how systems thinking prepares us for designing in complex spaces, and how experimentation gives us a path forward when we’re confronted with uncertainty in front of us and shifting foundations below us.

Walk out of this talk with a renewed focus on looking for moments of interconnected opportunities, ways to gain the insights you need to have conviction to move forward, and how to bring your leaders along with you as you successfully navigate these new environments and ecosystems.

snippet.description: #ux  #design  #research  #framework  #talk  #conference

localized.title: Activity-Based Research Interactions Talk by Meena Kothandaraman at UXLx 2023 #shorts  #ux #design
localized.description: #ux  #design  #research  #framework  #talk  #conference

snippet.title: Activity-Based Research Interactions
snippet.description:
Speaker: Meena Kothandaraman

Here is a scenario - does this resonate?

You conduct data gathering in a research study. As the researcher, you place heavy emphasis on how to ask the “right question”. Even after careful scrutiny of your questions, in your interactions with participants, you get shallow answers. This results in lots of chatter afterward about the participant being “good” or “bad”.

Let’s think about the details here.

Do you really ever deliver the question *exactly* as it is written? When was the last time you spoke about a topic that you don’t think about all the time, for one hour or longer? Are your thoughts always well-formed?

It’s time to rethink the way we connect with participants when asking them questions.

In this talk, Meena will introduce the concept of an activity-based protocol, one that invites participants to think more deeply about what they want to share, and in a way that allows them to unravel their own thoughts. By applying this approach, it also inherently removes emphasis on the researcher to craft the “right question”. Meena will share examples from the field that encourage participants to share rich answers, while also allowing everyone involved in the research process to have a bit of fun when listening to participant stories.

snippet.title: “Humans and AI Systems” Talk by Carol Smith @ UXLx 2023 #shorts
snippet.description: #ux   #design   #ai   #ethics   #talk   #conference

localized.title: “Humans and AI Systems” Talk by Carol Smith @ UXLx 2023 #shorts
localized.description: #ux   #design   #ai   #ethics   #talk   #conference

snippet.title: Humans and AI Systems
snippet.description:
Speaker: Carol Smith

AI-enabled systems that are responsible and human-centered, will be powerful partners to humans in the very near future. UX research (UXR) is necessary to create systems that people are willing to be responsible for. This talk describes the UXR skills and methods that are needed for proper data identification and preparation, bias identification, prevention of harm, human-machine interaction design and prototyping, and the critical oversight activities needed for dynamic AI systems to continue to be effective.

These UXR skills and methods support creation of AI-enabled systems that responsibly augment human abilities. AI-enabled systems that provide appropriate evidence of system capabilities and integrity will support calibrated trust (an individual’s balanced view of the risks and rewards of collaboration), and UXR informs what is appropriate in each context, how the AI system will augment the experience, and how the dynamic nature of the experience will be managed. This session will introduce each of these complex topics and provide references for further exploration of these exciting issues.

snippet.title: Untold AI
snippet.description:
Speaker: Chris Noessel

Most people know about AI through movies and TV shows. This one has an unblinking, red eye. That one crushes human skulls under its metal—and humanoid—foot. But how does the AI seen on screen match up with the science of AI? How does what you’ve seen color the way you think about it? How optimistic you are? What you think should be done, and how you would vote on AI policy?

Join Chris Noessel, keeper of scifiinterfaces.com, as he explains what screen AI aligns with the science, what is pure fiction, and what we should be telling ourselves but aren’t.

snippet.title: A CGI 3D Short Film: "Instinct" - by ESMA | TheCGBros
snippet.description:
TheCGBros Presents "Instinct" - by ESMA - After a diving excursion in the middle of the ocean, Lindsey is viciously assaulted by Bruce, her instructor. She fends him off and they fall overboard into the water. Bruce grabs her and sinks her to the depths of the ocean. In this spiral of violence, she has no way to breathe.

Alors qu’elle se déséquipe de son matériel de plongée, Lindsey se fait sauvagement agresser par Bruce, son moniteur.
Elle se débat et dans l’agitation, ils tombent à l’eau. Bruce la saisit et l’attire dans les profondeurs de l’océan. Dans cette spirale de violence, elle n’a aucun moyen de respirer.

Réalisateurs / directors: Bastien Hemery, Enzo Cransac, Charlene Ombrouck, Felix Gourlaouen, Jérémy Cetre, Lucie Dohen, Emma Lebourgeois et Tristan Giandoriggio
Musique / music : Hassan Ali 
Voix / voices: Frédéric Perchet, Charlène Ombrouck
Son / sound: José Vicente, Guilhem Favard, Mickaël Merrheim, Yoann Poncet - STUDIO DES AVIATEURS

Film d'animation réalisé dans le cadre de la formation cinéma d'animation 3D de l'école ESMA (promo 2022). 

© ESMA - Ecole Supérieure des Métiers Artistiques

snippet.title: A CGI 3D Short Film: "Flamme" - by ESMA | TheCGBros
snippet.description:
TheCGBros Presents "Flamme" by ESMA - Norea, a lonely wood sculptor, is frustrated by her constant failure in her art. One day, after an umpteenth trial, she breaks down. However, while contemplating her broken art in a fire, she finds a burning and overflowing inspiration in the swirling brazier.

Noréa, une sculptrice sur bois esseulée, ne trouve aucune satisfaction à travers ses créations. Un jour, lors d’une énième tentative, elle craque. C’est en contemplant son échec dans les flammes qu’elle va retrouver l’inspiration. Une passion brûlante et débordante.

Réalisateurs / directors: Arthur FORNARA, Lola ALONSO, Damien VALES, Océane PAPET, Yoann PARDO, Clément TERRAS, Cosmin GEANGU et Sylvain RODRIGUEZ
Musique / music : Sacha Duru
Musiciens / musicians: Francis Toussaint, Robin Leloup
Voix / Voices: Alicia Darmon, Marion Tardif
Son / sound: José Vicente, Yoann Poncet, Guilhem Favard, Mickaël Merrheim - STUDIO DES AVIATEURS

Film d'animation réalisé dans le cadre de la formation cinéma d'animation 3D de l'école ESMA (promo 2022).

snippet.title: A Unreal Engine Short Film: “Tokyo: The Box” - By Ninja Lama Bros | TheCGBros
snippet.description:
TheCGBros Presents "TOKYO: THE BOX" by Ninja Lama Bros - The video tells the story of a conflict within a gangster cell in one of Tokyo's alleyways. This project was made in an FPV format, resembling a game cutscene. A unique musical theme was created by Eugene Krasnoded, and voice acting was performed by Brad Gibb and Michael Yoshimura.

Team Members:

localized.description:
TheCGBros Presents "TOKYO: THE BOX" by Ninja Lama Bros - The video tells the story of a conflict within a gangster cell in one of Tokyo's alleyways. snippet.description:
TheCGBros Presents "The Lonely Lighthouse" by Keion Ing - A lonely tree spirit dreams of companionship, and when a glimmer of opportunity arises, he takes the first step into the unknown to pursue his dream. For more information, please see the details and links below:

snippet.title: A CGI 3D Short Film: "Trajectoire" - by ESMA | TheCGBros
snippet.description:
TheCGBros Presents "Trajectoire" by ESMA (Ecole Supérieure des Métiers Artistiques) - A character is fascinated by a world that hurts him by creating distortions on his body. To face this pain, he finds refuge in a sphere that is cast in the back of his boat. He’s safe in there, it heals him and resorbs his distortions. The healing process takes a long time in this lifeless environment. Our character is attracted by the outside world while waiting in this sphere, even though it offers him a safe place.

TEAM: Directed by Guillaume Beguin, Serena Longo, Brice Esquer, Léon Rousseau, Nathalie Hurtak, Allan Savarit-Bodin, Noémie Layre and Clement Wallez.
Compositor: Yanis Greenskin
Musique / music: Yanis Greenskin
Son / Sound: Guilhem Favard, Mickaël Merrheim, José Vicente, Yoann Poncet – Studio des aviateurs 


© ESMA - Ecole Supérieure des Métiers Artistiques
——————————————————————————————————————————————————————

snippet.title: CGI & VFX Breakdowns: "COSMOBALL Games"- by Main Road Post | TheCGBros
snippet.description:
Check out this revealing Games VFX Breakdown for "COSMOBALL" from the talented team at Main Road Post. For more information, please see the details and links below: Their VFX magic included designing intricate spaceships and expansive futuristic environments, crafting detailed alien creatures and characters, and handling complex simulations like explosions and energy effects. One of their standout achievements was the creation of the Cosmoball Arena, a massive, high-tech stadium central to the film's action. Their expertise in compositing and integration ensured all VFX elements seamlessly blended with the live-action footage, making the world of "Cosmoball" truly immersive and visually stunning.

snippet.description: Shortcuts, hotkeys, and sneaky UI features - there's tons of small things to implement daily in your developing journey to save a little time & keep things moving without interrupting your flow. snippet.title: Hawkeye VFX
snippet.description:
A key feature of our work on Marvel Studios’ Hawkeye is the high-speed car chase where Hawkeye and his sidekick are pursued across the streets of Brooklyn, through a Christmas tree sales yard, and onto the Manhattan Bridge. Using a fully digital model of the bridge combined with matte paintings and CG set extensions, we transformed plates shot on location into the familiar skylines of New York. See the highlights on our VFX sizzle reel. 

Artists and Innovators in the World of Digital Entertainment.

Find us here:
Home - https://www.wetafx.co.nz/
YouTube - https://www.youtube.com/user/WetaDigitalVisualFX
Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/wetadigitalvfx/
Twitter - https://twitter.com/weta_digital?lang=en
Instagram - https://www.instagram.com/weta_digital/?hl=en
Linked-In - https://www.linkedin.com/company/weta-digital/

#Hawkeye #MarvelStudios #VFX

snippet.title: Shang-Chi and the Legend of the Ten Rings VFX Breakdown
snippet.description:
Our work features in the epic third act battle of Marvel Studios’ Shang-Chi and the Legend of the Ten Rings. We created the Great Protector dragon and the Dweller-in-Darkness, as well as the army of soul-sucking demons. We were also responsible for the effects for the ten rings and complex water simulations in the realm of Ta Lo.

Artists and Innovators in the World of Digital Entertainment.

Find us here:
Home - https://www.wetafx.co.nz/
YouTube - https://www.youtube.com/user/WetaDigitalVisualFX
Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/wetadigitalvfx/

snippet.title: The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King VFX | Weta Digital
snippet.description:
The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King is the epic conclusion to The Lord of Rings trilogy, and the result of almost a decade’s worth of creative and technological innovation. It encompasses ground-breaking technology and techniques. We used a multitude of sophisticated visual effects to create landscapes and creatures of unprecedented scale and complexity.
Our work on The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King won the Academy Award® for Best Visual Effects, and the BAFTA Award for Best Special Visual Effects.

Artists and Innovators in the World of Digital Entertainment.

Find us here:
Home - https://www.wetafx.co.nz/
YouTube - https://www.youtube.com/user/WetaDigitalVisualFX
Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/wetadigitalvfx/
Twitter - https://twitter.com/weta_digital?lang=en

snippet.title: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring VFX | Weta Digital
snippet.description:
The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring saw many technological breakthroughs for Weta Digital and the VFX industry. It features monumental battles with digital characters, fantastical landscapes and CG creatures created with newly developed, cutting-edge software tools.
Our work on The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring won  the Academy® Award for Best Visual Effects, the BAFTA Award for Best Special Visual Effects, and the AEAF Award for Feature Film VFX.

localized.title: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring VFX | Weta Digital
localized.description:
The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring saw many technological breakthroughs for Weta Digital and the VFX industry. It features monumental battles with digital characters, fantastical landscapes and CG creatures created with newly developed, cutting-edge software tools.
Our work on The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring won  the Academy® Award for Best Visual Effects, the BAFTA Award for Best Special Visual Effects, and the AEAF Award for Feature Film VFX.

Artists and Innovators in the World of Digital Entertainment.

snippet.title: Jungle Cruise VFX | Weta Digital
snippet.description:
Weta Digital’s contribution to Disney’s Jungle Cruise focused primarily on creating environments—including hundreds of kilometres of CG Amazon River, with mist, waterfalls and rapids—as well as the creatures that populate the jungle. We created and hand-animated Frank’s ever-loyal, and fully CG, pet jaguar Proxima, and crafted motion vignettes for the abundance of birds, bugs and monkeys that call the jungle home.

Artists and Innovators in the World of Digital Entertainment.

snippet.description:

snippet.title: The Art of Virtual Production with Weta Digital
snippet.description:
Earlier in the year, our Executive Producer David Conley and two of our VFX Supervisors, Erik Winquist and Stephen Unterfranz, joined Shadow in the Cloud director Rosanne Liang on a panel for the DGA Virtual Production event. They had an open conversation about modern virtual production technology, including two projects with different LED workflows, and discussed in detail the learnings and challenges they experienced with some of our earlier LED virtual production projects.

Artists and Innovators in the World of Digital Entertainment.

snippet.title: What Up What Up Podcast Here! Ep1 with Haz Dulull
snippet.description:
Join me in this captivating episode as I sit down with the visionary filmmaker and game developer, Haz Dulull. Dive deep into the creative process behind his latest animated sci-fi thriller, ‘Max Beyond’, a film that pushes the boundaries of animation and storytelling through the power of Unreal Engine. Discover how Dulull brings to life the tale of Max, a young boy with the extraordinary ability to warp reality across parallel universes, in a quest to escape a sinister research facility.

But that’s not all – Haz Dulull also takes us on a journey through the development of ‘Moontopia’, his groundbreaking game created using Unreal Editor for Fortnite (UEFN). Explore the innovative techniques and the seamless integration of Unreal Engine and Cinema 4D that culminate in an immersive gaming experience unlike any other.

Whether you’re a film enthusiast, a gaming aficionado, or a creative professional, this episode is a treasure trove of insights into the fusion of cinema and gaming technologies. Tune in and be inspired by Haz Dulull’s passion for storytelling and his mastery of digital worlds.

More about Haz:
@hazimation_studio 
https://twitter.com/HaZ_Dulull
https://www.instagram.com/hazdazzle
https://giphy.com/channel/hazimation
hazimation.com

Watch Max Beyond
https://tv.apple.com/gb/movie/max-beyond/umc.cmc.463z3v8cvyolu9mif520nmndf

localized.title: What Up What Up Podcast Here! Ep1 with Haz Dulull
localized.description:
Join me in this captivating episode as I sit down with the visionary filmmaker and game developer, Haz Dulull. Dive deep into the creative process behind his latest animated sci-fi thriller, ‘Max Beyond’, a film that pushes the boundaries of animation and storytelling through the power of Unreal Engine. Discover how Dulull brings to life the tale of Max, a young boy with the extraordinary ability to warp reality across parallel universes, in a quest to escape a sinister research facility.

But that’s not all – Haz Dulull also takes us on a journey through the development of ‘Moontopia’, his groundbreaking game created using Unreal Editor for Fortnite (UEFN). Explore the innovative techniques and the seamless integration of Unreal Engine and Cinema 4D that culminate in an immersive gaming experience unlike any other.

Whether you’re a film enthusiast, a gaming aficionado, or a creative professional, this episode is a treasure trove of insights into the fusion of cinema and gaming technologies. Tune in and be inspired by Haz Dulull’s passion for storytelling and his mastery of digital worlds.

More about Haz:
@hazimation_studio

snippet.title: Unreal Engine 5 Camera Recording with Xbox Controller
snippet.description:
Dive into the world of Unreal Engine 5 and discover the ease of recording cinematic camera movements using an Xbox controller. This tutorial simplifies the process, making it accessible for creators of all skill levels. Whether you’re animating for games, films, or virtual productions, you’ll learn how to seamlessly control the UE5 camera, capture dynamic shots, and enhance your workflow. Perfect for motion graphics artists and Unreal enthusiasts looking to add fluid camera motion to their toolkit.

Other Tutorials You Might Like:

snippet.title: Worldbuilding in VR with Unity's XR Interaction Toolkit
snippet.description:
In this video, we'll be looking at how to set up the Editor for VR development, installing the XR Interaction Toolkit 2.5.x for Unity 2022 LTS, and how the VR sample works. 

You’ll learn how you can build your project from scratch using the prefabs included in the sample to speed up the creation of your project, how you can create interactivity without any code, and some common practices and techniques that can assist you in your VR game development. 

We test our project with the XR Device Simulator in Unity and a Meta Quest 2 device. Note that what you learn in this video can be applied to the upcoming version XR Interaction Toolkit 3.0 or Unity 6.

If you want to learn more, our comprehensive guide will help both aspiring creators and seasoned developers to delve into, and understand, the intricacies of building VR and MR experiences (or collectively referred to as “XR”) using Unity. 

More resources: 
The XR section in the Unity Manual: https://on.unity.com/4ctnOov  

XR Interaction Toolkit in the Unity Manual: https://on.unity.com/4cow8Xj  

Create virtual and mixed reality experiences in Unity E-book: https://on.unity.com/4btCW4y

00:00 - Intro
00:05 - Setting up the Editor for VR development
04:28 - Walkthrough the XR Interaction Toolkit demo scene
07:08 - Creating a new VR scene
13:02 - Setting up the Socket Interactor 
21:04 - Creating teleportation points
24:28 - XR Device Simulator
27:17 - Building to device and deploying to your VR hardware

snippet.title: How to work with humanoid animations in Unity
snippet.description:
Working with humanoid animations in Unity

Animation is a crucial part in games and Unity’s Animation system has been supporting projects for several years. In this video we will show you how to use the Animations systems in Unity to import existing characters and animations into your project. We’re going to look at key tips and techniques for working with humanoid characters in Unity, set up the Animation Controller, Inverse Kinematics or path finding for enemies AI. 

If you want to learn more about the animation system in Unity, check out our latest guide for both experienced and new animators 'The definitive guide to animation in Unity': https://on.unity.com/4b0z1Ma

We’ve also launched Muse Animate for helping you rapidly generate humanoid animations through natural language. This in-Editor prerelease package is available for all Muse users. With this new version, you can create Unity Animation Clips directly within the Unity Editor and easily retarget them to work with characters that use the Unity Humanoid Rig. More information:  unity.com/muse and https://on.unity.com/3VndZlk

Time Stamps: 
00:00 - Intro
00:21 - Downloading animations
02:17 - Using Root Motion
03:40 - Modifying animations
05:35 - Player-controlled animations
06:30 - Merging animations using layers and Avatar masks
09:04 - Player movement control
10:43 - AI character navigation

snippet.title: The Power of Photo Advocacy: A Conversation with Scott Wilson
snippet.description:
This week Scott Wilson, a photo advocate based in Denver, Colorado shares his inspiring journey from landscape photograph to also becoming a passionate advocate for wildlife and cancer awareness. He discusses his experiences with stage four colon cancer, the healing power of photography, and his transition to wildlife photography, particularly focusing on wild horses. Scott also talks about the importance of photo advocacy and how photographers can use their craft to support causes they believe in.


Scott Wilson’s Website: http://www.photoadvocacy.org
Instagram: @photoadvocacy_wilsonxp
Facebook: WilsonAXP Photo Advocacy

Check out our podcast at http://www.thisweekinphoto.com

snippet.title: Crafting Cravings! Food and Beverage Photography with Freddy Clark
snippet.description:
Freddy Clark, a renowned food and beverage photographer, joins the show to discuss the intricate world of capturing mouthwatering images. 

Freddy shares his journey from working in radio to discovering his passion for photography and eventually specializing in food and beverage photography. He provides valuable insights into the challenges and rewards of this genre, the impact of technology on the industry, and how he adapts to the ever-evolving landscape of photography. 

Freddy also offers practical tips and tricks for aspiring photographers looking to break into this field.

https://freddyclark.photography/

snippet.title: Celebrity Portraits & Film Photography with Jesse Dittmar at Photoville 2024
snippet.description:
Join us for an insightful conversation with renowned celebrity portrait photographer Jesse Dittmar at Photoville 2024! 📸✨

In this interview, Jesse shares his journey of photographing some of the most notable names in the world and his unique approach to portrait photography. From his experiences working with Annie Leibovitz to his passion for shooting on film, Jesse delves into the nuances that set his work apart.

Discover why Jesse prefers film over digital, the tactile nature of film photography, and how using vintage lenses enhances his portraits. He also discusses his current exploration into color film and his excitement about discovering new talents in the industry.

Jesse offers valuable advice for aspiring photographers, particularly those looking to become successful assistants. Learn about the persistence, curiosity, and dedication required to make it in the competitive world of photography.

Key Points:

 • Jesse Dittmar’s journey as a celebrity portrait photographer
 • The advantages of shooting on film
 • Exploring color film for the first time
 • Finding and photographing up-and-coming talents
 • Advice for aspiring photography assistants

Connect with Jesse Dittmar:
🌐 Website: JesseDittmar.com
📷 Instagram: @jessiedittmar

snippet.title: Innovative Photography Gear with Larry Tiefenbrunn from Platypod
snippet.description:
Get ready for an exciting discussion with Larry Tiefenbrunn, the mastermind behind Platypod, at Photoville 2024! 📸✨

In this interview, Larry introduces us to the innovative world of Platypod, showcasing their unique flat tripods and the revolutionary Platyball. Learn how these tools can transform your photography by allowing you to capture shots from low angles and tight spaces, perfect for macro photography.

Larry shares his passion for both saving lives as a doctor and influencing the photography industry through Platypod. Discover what’s next for Platypod, including hints about an upcoming Kickstarter campaign and new products in the pipeline.

Key Points:

 • Introduction to Platypod and its unique photography tools
 • The benefits of using Platypod’s flat tripods and Platyball
 • Larry’s dual passion for medicine and photography
 • Upcoming products and innovations from Platypod
 • How to stay updated with Platypod’s latest news and offers

Connect with Platypod:
🌐 Website: Platypod.com

snippet.title: Behind the Scenes of Photoville with Founders Suchan Vodoor & Sam Barzilay
snippet.description:
Dive into the story behind Photoville with its founders, Suchan and Sam, at Photoville 2024! 📸✨

In this interview, Suchan and Sam share the origins and evolution of Photoville, an innovative photography festival that transforms shipping containers into art exhibits. Learn about their vision of creating an accessible, community-driven space for photographers and art lovers to gather and share their work.

Discover how Photoville has grown from a small event with four containers to a massive festival with over 87 exhibits, fostering a sense of community and encouraging artistic expression. Suchan and Sam also discuss the importance of making art accessible and their future plans for Photoville.

Key Points:

 • The origins and growth of Photoville
 • Transforming shipping containers into art exhibits
 • Creating a community-driven space for photographers
 • The importance of accessible art and public engagement
 • Future plans and expansions for Photoville

Connect with Photoville:
🌐 Website: Photoville.com

snippet.title: TWiP Goes Back to the Future. And the Future of Content Creation!
snippet.description:
I'm excited to announce the relaunch and rebranding of our podcast, now simply known as “TWiP.” This new chapter brings a fresh look, an enhanced website, and a return to the engaging roundtable discussions you love. 

We're committed to delivering top-notch content and fostering insightful conversations with industry legends and fresh voices. Join us on this new journey in the world of photography and content creation.

In this episode of This Week in Photo, Frederick Van Johnson hosts a lively discussion with Mike “Sharky” James, Steve Brazill, Steve Simon, and Troy Miller on the future of content creation. They explore the importance of quality over quantity in podcasts and YouTube videos, the impact of advertisements on audience engagement, and the evolving trends in video and audio media. 

The panelists share their insights on maintaining content quality amidst a flood of new creators and discuss how to stand out in a crowded digital landscape.

See this episode and more at http://www.thisweekinphoto.com

Learn about his journey, the challenges he faces in capturing the perfect shot, and the unique blend of skills that make his photography stand out. This is an episode you won’t want to miss!

http://www.behindtheshot.tv

snippet.title: How Photography Saved My Life – With Matt Jacob
snippet.description:
In this episode I had the pleasure of speaking with Matt Jacob, a passionate traveling portrait photographer. Matt has an intriguing background, initially dreaming of becoming a pilot, which he pursued, allowing him the privilege of traveling the world. His journeys fueled a growing curiosity about diverse cultures and sparked his interest in photography as a means to capture the beauty and uniqueness he encountered.

Matt's photography journey began with a simple fascination for gadgets, evolving into a deeper engagement with the art form after attending a workshop that profoundly impacted his understanding of light and composition. Throughout the interview, Matt emphasized the importance of respect and empathy in photography, particularly when interacting with different cultures and environments.

IG: http://www.instagram.com/mattyj_ay
Site: http://www.mattjacobphotography.com

---

Subscribe to the podcast at http://www.thisweekinphoto.com

Matt's photography journey began with a simple fascination for gadgets, evolving into a deeper engagement with the art form after attending a workshop that profoundly impacted his understanding of light and composition. Throughout the interview, Matt emphasized the importance of respect and empathy in photography, particularly when interacting with different cultures and environments.

IG: http://www.instagram.com/mattyj_ay
Site: http://www.mattjacobphotography.com

---

Subscribe to the podcast at http://www.thisweekinphoto.com

snippet.title: Capturing Conservation: Inside the Mobilizing for Monuments Road Trip!
snippet.description:
This week features a behind-the-scenes look at the making of the Mobilizing for Monuments documentary. I sat down with Anton Lorimer and Alastair Jolly, the creative minds behind this incredible project, which showcases the collaboration between Flickr, The Conservation Alliance, and Rivian to highlight the beauty and importance of America's national monuments.

In our conversation, Anton and Alastair share fascinating stories about the logistics and challenges they faced while creating the documentary. From planning the route to managing the production crew, they offer a unique perspective on what it takes to bring a project like this to life.

We also dive into the experience of driving Rivian electric vehicles through areas with minimal supercharger infrastructure. As photographers, we often find ourselves in remote locations, and Anton and Alastair discuss the innovative solutions they employed to ensure they could complete their journey while minimizing their environmental impact.

Throughout the episode, you'll gain insights into the creative process behind the documentary and learn how photography can be a powerful tool for storytelling and raising awareness about important issues like conservation.

Whether you're interested in the technical aspects of filmmaking, the adventure of a road trip through America's stunning landscapes, or the role of photography in environmental advocacy, this episode has something for everyone.

The film debuts on April 18th, 2024, keep an eye on The Conservation Alliance to watch it!
https://conservationalliance.com

snippet.title: Future-Proofing Your Digital Workflow: A Deep Dive into NAS Solutions with Jeffrey Totaro
snippet.description:
Join us for this encore presentation of a truly enlightening episode of This Week in Photo, where I, Frederick Van Johnson, sit down with architectural photographer Jeffrey Totaro. Dive into the complexities of digital storage solutions as Jeffrey shares his journey from burning DVDs to adopting a robust network-attached storage (NAS) system. 

Whether you're struggling with your current storage setup or looking for ways to future-proof your digital workflow, this episode offers valuable insights into scalable, reliable storage options, the importance of redundancy, and the practicalities of implementing a sophisticated NAS system. 

Don't miss out on expert advice to safeguard your digital creations and streamline your workflow.

Connect with Jeffrey: https://www.jeffreytotaro.com
Check out our podcast at: http://www.thisweekinphoto.com

snippet.title: The Creative Act by Rick Rubin - Visual Book on a Page Summary - Should YOU read it?
snippet.description:
A high-resolution PNG, JPG, SVG, and the .excalidraw version of this Book-on-a-Page is available here: https://ko-fi.com/s/2a4b03d731
-----
✏️ Sign up for the Visual Thinking Workshop: https://www.visual-thinking-workshop.com/ 
🚀 Cohort 10 starts on 24 August 2024. 📔 We will process Simple Marketing for Smart People by Billy Broas into a Book on a Page
-----
In this video, I summarize and reflect on Rick Rubin's new book, "The Creative Act," while enjoying my holiday in the Alps. I'll share my insights from Cohort 9 of the Visual Thinking Workshop, where we explored the book through illustrations. Despite finding the book disorganized and occasionally off-putting with its references to "the universe," I delve into its core ideas about creativity. Rubin emphasizes that everyone is a creator, and creativity isn't confined to traditional art forms. He talks about "The Source" of inspiration, the importance of filtering and curating ideas, planting creative seeds, experimenting, crafting, and ultimately completing and sharing one's work. Join me as I discuss these themes and my own takeaways from Rubin's meditations on creativity. Don't forget to check the links below for my book-on-a-page summary and information about joining Cohort 10 of the Visual Thinking Workshop. Enjoy!

-----
If you find  my videos helpful, please say thanks by buying me a coffee: https://ko-fi.com/zsolt

-----

snippet.title: Slow Reading Master: How my visual book summary process has evolved
snippet.description:
✏️ Sign up for the Visual Thinking Workshop: https://www.visual-thinking-workshop.com/ 
🚀 Cohort 10 starts on 24 August 2024. 📔 We will process Simple Marketing for Smart People into a Book on a Page
-----
In this video, I share  my evolving process for creating Book-on-a-Page visual summaries, inspired by Tiago Forte's Progressive Summarization. Unlike speed reading, my method involves immersing myself in a book over 6-8 weeks, blending research, illustration, and deep thinking.

I start by engaging with the book before reading it, often by listening to interviews with the author. This initial step helps me map out the primary ideas and establish context. As I read, I import my highlights into Obsidian, creating a new file for each chapter to keep my notes organized and maintain context. I then review and illustrate each section, integrating these visuals into my notes.

To enhance my understanding and connections, I use Nick Milo's NoMa method and Vicky Zhao's Idea Compass, mapping ideas spatially in ExcaliBrain. This approach keeps me in constant dialogue with the material, deepening my insights and connections to existing notes.

Finally, I compile these visuals into a cohesive Book-on-a-Page summary, reflecting my personal journey with the book and its integration into my broader knowledge base. This method, while time-intensive, offers rich and engaging insights.

If you're interested in a deeper, more meaningful reading experience, I encourage you to try this method. For more on Visual Thinking with Excalidraw and ExcaliBrain, join the Visual Thinking Workshop. Cohort 10 starts at the end of August, with an early bird offer available until the end of June. 
-----
If you find  my videos helpful, please say thanks by buying me a coffee: https://ko-fi.com/zsolt

📩 If you want to connect, you can reach me: (@zsviczian) on the Obsidian Members Group (OMG) on Discord, or on 🐦 Twitter: https://twitter.com/zsviczian
-----

I start by engaging with the book before reading it, often by listening to interviews with the author. This initial step helps me map out the primary ideas and establish context. As I read, I import my highlights into Obsidian, creating a new file for each chapter to keep my notes organized and maintain context. I then review and illustrate each section, integrating these visuals into my notes.

To enhance my understanding and connections, I use Nick Milo's NoMa method and Vicky Zhao's Idea Compass, mapping ideas spatially in ExcaliBrain. This approach keeps me in constant dialogue with the material, deepening my insights and connections to existing notes.

Finally, I compile these visuals into a cohesive Book-on-a-Page summary, reflecting my personal journey with the book and its integration into my broader knowledge base. This method, while time-intensive, offers rich and engaging insights.

If you're interested in a deeper, more meaningful reading experience, I encourage you to try this method. For more on Visual Thinking with Excalidraw and ExcaliBrain, join the Visual Thinking Workshop. Cohort 10 starts at the end of August, with an early bird offer available until the end of June. 
-----
If you find  my videos helpful, please say thanks by buying me a coffee: https://ko-fi.com/zsolt

📩 If you want to connect, you can reach me: (@zsviczian) on the Obsidian Members Group (OMG) on Discord, or on 🐦 Twitter: https://twitter.com/zsviczian

snippet.title: Improved Text Tool and better Scribble support in Excalidraw-Obsidian 2.2.4
snippet.description:
✏️ Sign up for the Visual Thinking Workshop: https://www.visual-thinking-workshop.com/ 

Handwriting just got an upgrade. You can now drag the Text Tool to set text width, making it much easier to start scribbling. This works great with both Apple Scribble and newer Samsung SPen devices. Plus, your text will wrap seamlessly, so you won't need to bother with long lines and breaks. Just remember, Scribble support may depend on your language settings.

snippet.title: Rethink Writing: Think Visually, Your Brain is Not Linear
snippet.description:
✏️ Sign up for the Visual Thinking Workshop: https://www.visual-thinking-workshop.com/ 
🚀 Cohort 9 starts on 2 June 2024. 📔 We will process The Creative Act by Rick Rubin into a Book on a Page
-----
In this video, I explore the concept of visual thinking and challenge the traditional reliance on writing as the primary tool for organizing thoughts. I argue that visual representations, like maps or diagrams, provide a clearer and more efficient way to understand and manage information compared to text alone. I'll also discuss examples from engineering and legal documentation to highlight the benefits of visual thinking. Join me as I advocate for a balance between writing and visual thinking to enhance clarity and understanding. If you're interested in learning more, check out my Visual Thinking workshop starting soon. Like, subscribe, and share your thoughts below!
-----
If you find  my videos helpful, please say thanks by buying me a coffee: https://ko-fi.com/zsolt

📩 If you want to connect, you can reach me: (@zsviczian) on the Obsidian Members Group (OMG) on Discord, or on 🐦 Twitter: https://twitter.com/zsviczian
-----
Timestamps:
00:00 Intro
01:02 Writing as a tool for thinking is overrated
01:54 Why are IT project documents text-heavy?
02:34 Visual tools help you juggle new complex concepts
03:16 Shop receipt vs. Shop window
03:33 Which is easier to understand detailed directions or a map?
04:20 Should we use Excel or UML Requirements diagrams for requirements analysis?
04:52 Legal documents are the best worst example of writing as a form of efficient communication
05:35 Author interviews offer a different type of visualization of the book you are reading
06:06 Using visuals to craft a storyline
06:49 If you can't visualize something, do you really understand it?
07:31 Extreme visual thinking: Xu Bing, Book From The Ground
08:04 Closing thoughts - Is it true, that writing is thinking?
-------

snippet.title: Book on a Page Summary of Atomic Habits by James Clear
snippet.description:
A high-resolution PNG, SVG, and the .excalidraw version of this Book-on-a-Page is available here: https://ko-fi.com/s/e39438cfab
-----
✏️ Sign up for the Visual Thinking Workshop: https://www.visual-thinking-workshop.com/ 
🚀 Cohort 9 starts on 2 June 2024. 📔 We will process The Creative Act by Rick Rubin into a Book on a Page
-----
In this video, I delve into the key takeaways from Atomic Habits by James Clear. As we wrap up Cohort 8 of the Visual Thinking Workshop, I reflect on the essence of the book and its application to our lives. We explore how tiny actions can lead to significant outcomes, emphasizing the importance of focusing on our identity and building effective systems.

The book emphasizes that every action we take is a vote for the type of person we wish to become. By understanding the power of habits, we can shape our identities and ultimately our lives. However, the process isn't static; it requires commitment and the right systems.

I dissect the four stages of habits and discuss the significance of making habits obvious, attractive, easy, and satisfying. Additionally, I share practical tools like implementation intentions and habit trackers to aid in habit formation.

Furthermore, we examine the concepts of flow, perception of time, willpower, and context. Understanding these factors helps us navigate challenges and stay consistent with our habits.

Ultimately, the goal isn't perfection but continuous improvement. By making small, consistent changes, we can achieve remarkable results over time. Join me as we explore the transformative power of habits and unlock our full potential.
-----
If you find  my videos helpful, please say thanks by buying me a coffee: https://ko-fi.com/zsolt

📩 If you want to connect, you can reach me: (@zsviczian) on the Obsidian Members Group (OMG) on Discord, or on 🐦 Twitter: https://twitter.com/zsviczian
-----

05:09 Part 2: Focus on identity and systems
10:24 Part 3: Repetition is essential
12:42 Part 4: Flow, perception of time, willpower, and context
16:13 About the Visual Thinking Workshop
16:35 Sneak peek behind the scenes - How this is more than just a pretty picture
18:50 Closing remarks
-------

snippet.title: Diagramming for PKM: The Sun Ray Transformation Map for preparing to quit your 9-to-5 job
snippet.description:
✏️ Sign up for the Visual Thinking Workshop: https://www.visual-thinking-workshop.com/ 
🚀 Cohort 9 starts on 2 June 2024. 📔 We will process The Creative Act by Rick Rubin into a Book on a Page

-----
This video was created with Obsidian.md and the Excalidraw plugins using the Slideshow script (https://youtu.be/JwgtCrIVeEU)

-----
part 1 - Why diagrams matter in PKM: https://youtu.be/MGsplHhwoc8
part  2 - Concept modelling: https://youtu.be/Zg_DUj68VkY
part 2b - Concept modelling with Nick Milo (notemaking): https://youtu.be/ztCup77A77A 
part 3 - Systems Thinking with Object Process Modeling: https://youtu.be/se7odslzd5U
part 4 - Futures Wheel of Quitting my Job: https://youtu.be/Y5u7ggrxM1k
part 5 - Sun Ray Transformation Map: https://youtu.be/Y-cZrWlRAWc
-----
In this video, I delve into the art of strategic planning for those considering quitting their job, leveraging the Sun Ray Transformation Map to sketch out a clear action roadmap. I demonstrate using Excalidraw scripts and advanced features for effective visualization and how these tools integrate with the DataView plugin to manage actionable steps directly within Obsidian. Drawing on the wisdom of thinkers like Stephen Covey and Scott Galloway, I emphasize starting with a clear vision of the future and managing financial resources wisely to pursue dreams sustainably. Throughout the session, I guide you through creating a structured plan that covers immediate to long-term goals, focusing on financial stability, entrepreneurship, building relationships, and personal development. Join me to learn how to transform your aspirations into actionable strategies using visual thinking tools and ensure you're prepared for the opportunities ahead. Don't forget to like, subscribe, and share your thoughts below!
-----
If you find  my videos helpful, please say thanks by buying me a coffee: https://ko-fi.com/zsolt

📩 If you want to connect, you can reach me: (@zsviczian) on the Obsidian Members Group (OMG) on Discord, or on 🐦 Twitter: https://twitter.com/zsviczian
-----

localized.title: Diagramming for PKM: The Sun Ray Transformation Map for preparing to quit your 9-to-5 job
localized.description:
✏️ Sign up for the Visual Thinking Workshop: https://www.visual-thinking-workshop.com/ 
🚀 Cohort 9 starts on 2 June 2024. 📔 We will process The Creative Act by Rick Rubin into a Book on a Page

-----
This video was created with Obsidian.md and the Excalidraw plugins using the Slideshow script (https://youtu.be/JwgtCrIVeEU)

-----
part 1 - Why diagrams matter in PKM: https://youtu.be/MGsplHhwoc8
part  2 - Concept modelling: https://youtu.be/Zg_DUj68VkY
part 2b - Concept modelling with Nick Milo (notemaking): https://youtu.be/ztCup77A77A 
part 3 - Systems Thinking with Object Process Modeling: https://youtu.be/se7odslzd5U
part 4 - Futures Wheel of Quitting my Job: https://youtu.be/Y5u7ggrxM1k
part 5 - Sun Ray Transformation Map: https://youtu.be/Y-cZrWlRAWc
-----
In this video, I delve into the art of strategic planning for those considering quitting their job, leveraging the Sun Ray Transformation Map to sketch out a clear action roadmap. I demonstrate using Excalidraw scripts and advanced features for effective visualization and how these tools integrate with the DataView plugin to manage actionable steps directly within Obsidian. Drawing on the wisdom of thinkers like Stephen Covey and Scott Galloway, I emphasize starting with a clear vision of the future and managing financial resources wisely to pursue dreams sustainably. Throughout the session, I guide you through creating a structured plan that covers immediate to long-term goals, focusing on financial stability, entrepreneurship, building relationships, and personal development. Join me to learn how to transform your aspirations into actionable strategies using visual thinking tools and ensure you're prepared for the opportunities ahead. Don't forget to like, subscribe, and share your thoughts below!
-----
If you find  my videos helpful, please say thanks by buying me a coffee: https://ko-fi.com/zsolt

📩 If you want to connect, you can reach me: (@zsviczian) on the Obsidian Members Group (OMG) on Discord, or on 🐦 Twitter: https://twitter.com/zsviczian
-----

00:00 Intro
01:25 Drawing the Sun Ray Transformation Map template in Excalidraw
02:44 Slicing ellipses with the Split Ellipse Excalidraw Script
04:23 Embedding the Futures Wheel for reference and to link the two notes together
05:10 Developing the roadmap actions for Financial Stability
07:32 Using DataView query to access TODO items captured on the Excalidraw Canvas
09:37 Developing the roadmap actions for Building Relationships
11:41 Developing the roadmap actions for Developing Resilience
13:04 Developing the roadmap actions for Entrepreneurship
14:58 Closing Remarks: Develop your own roadmap and review it regularly

snippet.title: Diagramming for PKM: The Futures Wheel of Quitting my Job
snippet.description:
✏️ Sign up for the Visual Thinking Workshop: https://www.visual-thinking-workshop.com/ 
🚀 Cohort 9 starts on 2 June 2024. 📔 We will process The Creative Act by Rick Rubin into a Book on a Page

-----
This video was created with Obsidian.md and the Excalidraw plugins using the Slideshow script (https://youtu.be/JwgtCrIVeEU)
-----
part 1 - Why diagrams matter in PKM: https://youtu.be/MGsplHhwoc8
part  2 - Concept modelling: https://youtu.be/Zg_DUj68VkY
part 2b - Concept modelling with Nick Milo (notemaking): https://youtu.be/ztCup77A77A 
part 3 - Systems Thinking with Object Process Modeling: https://youtu.be/se7odslzd5U
part 4 - Futures Wheel of Quitting my Job: https://youtu.be/Y5u7ggrxM1k
part 5 - Sun Ray Transformation Map: https://youtu.be/Y-cZrWlRAWc
-----
This is the first part of a two-part mini-series where I introduce The Futures Wheel and later in part 2 the Sun Ray Transformation Map. Part 1 explores the web of primary, secondary, and tertiary impacts that stem from the decision to quit a nine-to-five job. Using Excalidraw in Obsidian, we dive into the possible emotional, financial, and social consequences that could unfold months and years down the line. I guide you through the process of creating your own Futures Wheel, showing how this tool can be both insightful and sobering as we explore the possible reality of such a life-changing choice. Join me as I map out the potential challenges and opportunities of taking such a leap, and how it might reshape personal and professional identity, lifestyle, and relationships.
-----
If you find  my videos helpful, please say thanks by buying me a coffee: https://ko-fi.com/zsolt

📩 If you want to connect, you can reach me: (@zsviczian) on the Obsidian Members Group (OMG) on Discord, or on 🐦 Twitter: https://twitter.com/zsviczian
-----
Timestamps:
00:00 Intro
00:45 The Futures Wheel
01:25 Adding the Central Scenario
02:11 Primary Impacts
04:32 Secondary Impacts
06:15 Tertiary Impacts
07:22 Risks vs. Opportunities
08:02 Validation with GPT4
09:02 Adding Details with Wiki Links
09:35 Closing
-------
